param.name: ArduSub:SURFACE_DEPTH
param.documentation: The depth the external pressure sensor will read when the vehicle is considered at the surface (in centimeters)

param.name: ArduSub:SYSID_SW_MREV
param.documentation: This value is incremented when changes are made to the eeprom format

param.name: ArduSub:SYSID_SW_TYPE
param.documentation: This is used by the ground station to recognise the software type (eg ArduPlane vs ArduCopter)

param.humanName: MAVLink system ID of this vehicle
param.name: ArduSub:SYSID_THISMAV
param.documentation: Allows setting an individual MAVLink system id for this vehicle to distinguish it from others on the same network

param.name: ArduSub:SYSID_MYGCS
param.documentation: Allows restricting radio overrides to only come from my ground station

param.name: ArduSub:PILOT_THR_FILT
param.documentation: Throttle filter cutoff (Hz) - active whenever altitude control is inactive - 0 to disable

param.name: ArduSub:GCS_PID_MASK
param.documentation: bitmask of PIDs to send MAVLink PID_TUNING messages for

param.name: ArduSub:RNGFND_GAIN
param.documentation: Used to adjust the speed with which the target altitude is changed when objects are sensed below the sub

param.name: ArduSub:FS_BATT_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls whether failsafe will be invoked when battery voltage or current runs low

param.name: ArduSub:FS_BATT_VOLTAGE
param.documentation: Battery voltage to trigger failsafe. Set to 0 to disable battery voltage failsafe.

param.name: ArduSub:FS_BATT_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining to trigger failsafe. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe.

param.name: ArduSub:FS_GCS_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls what action to take when GCS heartbeat is lost.

param.name: ArduSub:FS_LEAK_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls what action to take if a leak is detected.

param.name: ArduSub:FS_PRESS_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls what action to take if internal pressure exceeds FS_PRESS_MAX parameter.

param.name: ArduSub:FS_TEMP_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls what action to take if internal temperature exceeds FS_TEMP_MAX parameter.

param.name: ArduSub:FS_PRESS_MAX
param.documentation: The maximum internal pressure allowed before triggering failsafe. Failsafe action is determined by FS_PRESS_ENABLE parameter

param.name: ArduSub:FS_TEMP_MAX
param.documentation: The maximum internal temperature allowed before triggering failsafe. Failsafe action is determined by FS_TEMP_ENABLE parameter.

param.name: ArduSub:FS_TERRAIN_ENAB
param.documentation: Controls what action to take if terrain information is lost during AUTO mode

param.name: ArduSub:FS_PILOT_INPUT
param.documentation: Controls what action to take if no pilot input has been received after the timeout period specified by the FS_PILOT_TIMEOUT parameter

param.name: ArduSub:XTRACK_ANG_LIM
param.documentation: Maximum allowed angle (in degrees) between current track and desired heading during waypoint navigation

param.name: ArduSub:MAG_ENABLE
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the compass. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the compass

param.name: ArduSub:WP_YAW_BEHAVIOR
param.documentation: Determines how the autopilot controls the yaw during missions and RTL

param.name: ArduSub:PILOT_VELZ_MAX
param.documentation: The maximum vertical velocity the pilot may request in cm/s

param.name: ArduSub:PILOT_ACCEL_Z
param.documentation: The vertical acceleration used when pilot is controlling the altitude

param.name: ArduSub:THR_DZ
param.documentation: The deadzone above and below mid throttle. Used in AltHold, Loiter, PosHold flight modes

param.name: ArduSub:LOG_BITMASK
param.documentation: 4 byte bitmap of log types to enable

param.name: ArduSub:ANGLE_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum lean angle in all flight modes

param.name: ArduSub:RC_FEEL_RP
param.documentation: RC feel for roll/pitch which controls vehicle response to user input with 0 being extremely soft and 100 being crisp

param.name: ArduSub:FS_EKF_ACTION
param.documentation: Controls the action that will be taken when an EKF failsafe is invoked

param.name: ArduSub:FS_EKF_THRESH
param.documentation: Allows setting the maximum acceptable compass and velocity variance

param.name: ArduSub:FS_CRASH_CHECK
param.documentation: This enables automatic crash checking. When enabled the motors will disarm if a crash is detected.

param.name: ArduSub:JS_GAIN_DEFAULT
param.documentation: Default gain at boot, must be in range [JS_GAIN_MIN , JS_GAIN_MAX]

param.name: ArduSub:JS_GAIN_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum joystick gain

param.name: ArduSub:JS_GAIN_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum joystick gain

param.name: ArduSub:JS_GAIN_STEPS
param.documentation: Controls the number of steps between minimum and maximum joystick gain when the gain is adjusted using buttons. Set to 1 to always use JS_GAIN_DEFAULT.

param.name: ArduSub:JS_CAM_TILT_STEP
param.documentation: Size of PWM increment on camera tilt servo

param.name: ArduSub:JS_LIGHTS_STEP
param.documentation: Size of PWM increment on lights servo

param.name: ArduSub:JS_THR_GAIN
param.documentation: Scalar for gain on the throttle channel

param.name: ArduSub:CAM_CENTER
param.documentation: Servo PWM at camera center position

param.name: ArduSub:FRAME_CONFIG
param.documentation: Set this parameter according to your vehicle/motor configuration

param.name: ArduSub:RC_SPEED
param.documentation: This is the speed in Hertz that your ESCs will receive updates

param.humanName: Acro Roll and Pitch P gain
param.name: ArduSub:ACRO_RP_P
param.documentation: Converts pilot roll and pitch into a desired rate of rotation in ACRO and SPORT mode. Higher values mean faster rate of rotation.

param.name: ArduSub:ACRO_YAW_P
param.documentation: Converts pilot yaw input into a desired rate of rotation. Higher values mean faster rate of rotation.

param.name: ArduSub:ACRO_BAL_ROLL
param.documentation: rate at which roll angle returns to level in acro mode. A higher value causes the vehicle to return to level faster.

param.name: ArduSub:ACRO_BAL_PITCH
param.documentation: rate at which pitch angle returns to level in acro mode. A higher value causes the vehicle to return to level faster.

param.name: ArduSub:ACRO_TRAINER
param.documentation: Type of trainer used in acro mode

param.name: ArduSub:ACRO_EXPO
param.documentation: Acro roll/pitch Expo to allow faster rotation when stick at edges

param.name: ArduSub:VEL_XY_P
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) P gain. Converts the difference between desired velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: ArduSub:VEL_XY_I
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: ArduSub:VEL_XY_IMAX
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) integrator maximum. Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

param.name: ArduSub:VEL_XY_FILT_HZ
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) integrator maximum. Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

param.name: ArduSub:VEL_Z_P
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical speed and actual speed into a desired acceleration that is passed to the throttle acceleration controller

param.name: ArduSub:ACCEL_Z_P
param.documentation: Throttle acceleration controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration into a motor output

param.name: ArduSub:ACCEL_Z_I
param.documentation: Throttle acceleration controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration

param.humanName: Throttle acceleration controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduSub:ACCEL_Z_IMAX
param.documentation: Throttle acceleration controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pwm that the I term will generate

param.name: ArduSub:ACCEL_Z_D
param.documentation: Throttle acceleration controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired vertical acceleration vs actual acceleration

param.name: ArduSub:ACCEL_Z_FILT
param.documentation: Filter applied to acceleration to reduce noise. Lower values reduce noise but add delay.

param.name: ArduSub:POS_Z_P
param.documentation: Position (vertical) controller P gain. Converts the difference between the desired altitude and actual altitude into a climb or descent rate which is passed to the throttle rate controller

param.name: ArduSub:POS_XY_P
param.documentation: Loiter position controller P gain. Converts the distance (in the latitude direction) to the target location into a desired speed which is then passed to the loiter latitude rate controller

param.name: ArduSub:TERRAIN_FOLLOW
param.documentation: This enables terrain following for RTL and SURFACE flight modes. To use this option TERRAIN_ENABLE must be 1 and the GCS must support sending terrain data to the aircraft. In RTL the RTL_ALT will be considered a height above the terrain. In LAND mode the vehicle will slow to LAND_SPEED 10m above terrain (instead of 10m above home). This parameter does not affect AUTO and Guided which use a per-command flag to determine if the height is above-home, absolute or above-terrain.

values.value: Do Not Use in RTL and SURFACE

param.name: ArduPlane:FORMAT_VERSION
param.documentation: This value is incremented when changes are made to the eeprom format

param.name: ArduPlane:SYSID_SW_TYPE
param.documentation: This is used by the ground station to recognise the software type (eg ArduPlane vs ArduCopter)

param.humanName: MAVLink system ID of this vehicle
param.name: ArduPlane:SYSID_THISMAV
param.documentation: Allows setting an individual MAVLink system id for this vehicle to distinguish it from others on the same network

param.name: ArduPlane:SYSID_MYGCS
param.documentation: The identifier of the ground station in the MAVLink protocol. Don't change this unless you also modify the ground station to match.

param.name: ArduPlane:CLI_ENABLED
param.documentation: This enables/disables the checking for three carriage returns on telemetry links on startup to enter the diagnostics command line interface

param.name: ArduPlane:AUTOTUNE_LEVEL
param.documentation: Level of aggressiveness for autotune. When autotune is run a lower AUTOTUNE_LEVEL will result in a 'softer' tune, with less aggressive gains. For most users a level of 6 is recommended.

param.name: ArduPlane:TELEM_DELAY
param.documentation: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

param.name: ArduPlane:GCS_PID_MASK
param.documentation: bitmask of PIDs to send MAVLink PID_TUNING messages for

param.name: ArduPlane:KFF_RDDRMIX
param.documentation: The amount of rudder mix to apply during aileron movement 0 = 0 %, 1 = 100%

param.name: ArduPlane:KFF_THR2PTCH
param.documentation: Throttle to pitch feed-forward gain.

param.name: ArduPlane:STAB_PITCH_DOWN
param.documentation: This controls the amount of down pitch to add in FBWA and AUTOTUNE modes when at low throttle. No down trim is added when throttle is above TRIM_THROTTLE. Below TRIM_THROTTLE downtrim is added in proportion to the amount the throttle is below TRIM_THROTTLE. At zero throttle the full downpitch specified in this parameter is added. This parameter is meant to help keep airspeed up when flying in FBWA mode with low throttle, such as when on a landing approach, without relying on an airspeed sensor. A value of 2 degrees is good for many planes, although a higher value may be needed for high drag aircraft.

param.name: ArduPlane:GLIDE_SLOPE_MIN
param.documentation: This controls the minimum altitude change for a waypoint before a glide slope will be used instead of an immediate altitude change. The default value is 15 meters, which helps to smooth out waypoint missions where small altitude changes happen near waypoints. If you don't want glide slopes to be used in missions then you can set this to zero, which will disable glide slope calculations. Otherwise you can set it to a minimum number of meters of altitude error to the destination waypoint before a glide slope will be used to change altitude.

param.name: ArduPlane:GLIDE_SLOPE_THR
param.documentation: This controls the height above the glide slope the plane may be before rebuilding a glide slope. This is useful for smoothing out an autotakeoff

param.name: ArduPlane:STICK_MIXING
param.documentation: When enabled, this adds user stick input to the control surfaces in auto modes, allowing the user to have some degree of flight control without changing modes. There are two types of stick mixing available. If you set STICK_MIXING to 1 then it will use "fly by wire" mixing, which controls the roll and pitch in the same way that the FBWA mode does. This is the safest option if you usually fly ArduPlane in FBWA or FBWB mode. If you set STICK_MIXING to 2 then it will enable direct mixing mode, which is what the STABILIZE mode uses. That will allow for much more extreme maneuvers while in AUTO mode.

param.name: ArduPlane:AUTO_FBW_STEER
param.documentation: When enabled this option gives FBWA navigation and steering in AUTO mode. This can be used to allow manual stabilised piloting with waypoint logic for triggering payloads. With this enabled the pilot has the same control over the plane as in FBWA mode, and the normal AUTO navigation is completely disabled. THIS OPTION IS NOT RECOMMENDED FOR NORMAL USE.

param.name: ArduPlane:TKOFF_THR_MINSPD
param.documentation: Minimum GPS ground speed in m/s used by the speed check that un-suppresses throttle in auto-takeoff. This can be be used for catapult launches where you want the motor to engage only after the plane leaves the catapult, but it is preferable to use the TKOFF_THR_MINACC and TKOFF_THR_DELAY parameters for catapult launches due to the errors associated with GPS measurements. For hand launches with a pusher prop it is strongly advised that this parameter be set to a value no less than 4 m/s to provide additional protection against premature motor start. Note that the GPS velocity will lag the real velocity by about 0.5 seconds. The ground speed check is delayed by the TKOFF_THR_DELAY parameter.

param.name: ArduPlane:TKOFF_THR_MINACC
param.documentation: Minimum forward acceleration in m/s/s before arming the ground speed check in auto-takeoff. This is meant to be used for hand launches. Setting this value to 0 disables the acceleration test which means the ground speed check will always be armed which could allow GPS velocity jumps to start the engine. For hand launches and bungee launches this should be set to around 15.

param.name: ArduPlane:TKOFF_THR_DELAY
param.documentation: This parameter sets the time delay (in 1/10ths of a second) that the ground speed check is delayed after the forward acceleration check controlled by TKOFF_THR_MINACC has passed. For hand launches with pusher propellers it is essential that this is set to a value of no less than 2 (0.2 seconds) to ensure that the aircraft is safely clear of the throwers arm before the motor can start. For bungee launches a larger value can be used (such as 30) to give time for the bungee to release from the aircraft before the motor is started.

param.name: ArduPlane:TKOFF_TDRAG_ELEV
param.documentation: This parameter sets the amount of elevator to apply during the initial stage of a takeoff. It is used to hold the tail wheel of a taildragger on the ground during the initial takeoff stage to give maximum steering. This option should be combined with the TKOFF_TDRAG_SPD1 option and the GROUND_STEER_ALT option along with tuning of the ground steering controller. A value of zero means to bypass the initial "tail hold" stage of takeoff. Set to zero for hand and catapult launch. For tail-draggers you should normally set this to 100, meaning full up elevator during the initial stage of takeoff. For most tricycle undercarriage aircraft a value of zero will work well, but for some tricycle aircraft a small negative value (say around -20 to -30) will apply down elevator which will hold the nose wheel firmly on the ground during initial acceleration. Only use a negative value if you find that the nosewheel doesn't grip well during takeoff. Too much down elevator on a tricycle undercarriage may cause instability in steering as the plane pivots around the nosewheel. Add down elevator 10 percent at a time.

param.name: ArduPlane:TKOFF_TDRAG_SPD1
param.documentation: This parameter sets the airspeed at which to stop holding the tail down and transition to rudder control of steering on the ground. When TKOFF_TDRAG_SPD1 is reached the pitch of the aircraft will be held level until TKOFF_ROTATE_SPD is reached, at which point the takeoff pitch specified in the mission will be used to "rotate" the pitch for takeoff climb. Set TKOFF_TDRAG_SPD1 to zero to go straight to rotation. This should be set to zero for hand launch and catapult launch. It should also be set to zero for tricycle undercarriages unless you are using the method above to genetly hold the nose wheel down. For tail dragger aircraft it should be set just below the stall speed.

param.name: ArduPlane:TKOFF_ROTATE_SPD
param.documentation: This parameter sets the airspeed at which the aircraft will "rotate", setting climb pitch specified in the mission. If TKOFF_ROTATE_SPD is zero then the climb pitch will be used as soon as takeoff is started. For hand launch and catapult launches a TKOFF_ROTATE_SPD of zero should be set. For all ground launches TKOFF_ROTATE_SPD should be set above the stall speed, usually by about 10 to 30 percent

param.name: ArduPlane:TKOFF_THR_SLEW
param.documentation: This parameter sets the slew rate for the throttle during auto takeoff. When this is zero the THR_SLEWRATE parameter is used during takeoff. For rolling takeoffs it can be a good idea to set a lower slewrate for takeoff to give a slower acceleration which can improve ground steering control. The value is a percentage throttle change per second, so a value of 20 means to advance the throttle over 5 seconds on takeoff. Values below 20 are not recommended as they may cause the plane to try to climb out with too little throttle.

param.name: ArduPlane:TKOFF_PLIM_SEC
param.documentation: This parameter reduces the pitch minimum limit of an auto-takeoff just a few seconds before it reaches the target altitude. This reduces overshoot by allowing the flight controller to start leveling off a few seconds before reaching the target height. When set to zero, the mission pitch min is enforced all the way to and through the target altitude, otherwise the pitch min slowly reduces to zero in the final segment. This is the pitch_min, not the demand. The flight controller should still be commanding to gain altitude to finish the takeoff but with this param it is not forcing it higher than it wants to be.

param.name: ArduPlane:TKOFF_FLAP_PCNT
param.documentation: The amount of flaps (as a percentage) to apply in automatic takeoff

param.name: ArduPlane:FBWA_TDRAG_CHAN
param.documentation: This is a RC input channel which when it goes above 1700 enables FBWA taildragger takeoff mode. It should be assigned to a momentary switch. Once this feature is enabled it will stay enabled until the aircraft goes above TKOFF_TDRAG_SPD1 airspeed, changes mode, or the pitch goes above the initial pitch when this is engaged or goes below 0 pitch. When enabled the elevator will be forced to TKOFF_TDRAG_ELEV. This option allows for easier takeoffs on taildraggers in FBWA mode, and also makes it easier to test auto-takeoff steering handling in FBWA. Setting it to 0 disables this option.

param.name: ArduPlane:LEVEL_ROLL_LIMIT
param.documentation: This controls the maximum bank angle in degrees during flight modes where level flight is desired, such as in the final stages of landing, and during auto takeoff. This should be a small angle (such as 5 degrees) to prevent a wing hitting the runway during takeoff or landing. Setting this to zero will completely disable heading hold on auto takeoff and final landing approach.

param.humanName: Bitmask for when to allow negative reverse thrust
param.name: ArduPlane:USE_REV_THRUST
param.documentation: Typically THR_MIN will be clipped to zero unless reverse thrust is available. Since you may not want negative thrust available at all times this bitmask allows THR_MIN to go below 0 while executing certain auto-mission commands.

param.name: ArduPlane:NAV_CONTROLLER
param.documentation: Which navigation controller to enable. Currently the only navigation controller available is L1. From time to time other experimental controllers will be added which are selected using this parameter.

param.name: ArduPlane:ALT_CTRL_ALG
param.documentation: This sets what algorithm will be used for altitude control. The default is zero, which selects the most appropriate algorithm for your airframe. Currently the default is to use TECS (total energy control system). From time to time we will add other experimental altitude control algorithms which will be selected using this parameter.

param.name: ArduPlane:ALT_OFFSET
param.documentation: This is added to the target altitude in automatic flight. It can be used to add a global altitude offset to a mission

param.name: ArduPlane:WP_RADIUS
param.documentation: Defines the maximum distance from a waypoint that when crossed indicates the waypoint may be complete. To avoid the aircraft looping around the waypoint in case it misses by more than the WP_RADIUS an additional check is made to see if the aircraft has crossed a "finish line" passing through the waypoint and perpendicular to the flight path from the previous waypoint. If that finish line is crossed then the waypoint is considered complete. Note that the navigation controller may decide to turn later than WP_RADIUS before a waypoint, based on how sharp the turn is and the speed of the aircraft. It is safe to set WP_RADIUS much larger than the usual turn radius of your aircraft and the navigation controller will work out when to turn. If you set WP_RADIUS too small then you will tend to overshoot the turns.

param.name: ArduPlane:WP_MAX_RADIUS
param.documentation: Sets the maximum distance to a waypoint for the waypoint to be considered complete. This overrides the "cross the finish line" logic that is normally used to consider a waypoint complete. For normal AUTO behaviour this parameter should be set to zero. Using a non-zero value is only recommended when it is critical that the aircraft does approach within the given radius, and should loop around until it has done so. This can cause the aircraft to loop forever if its turn radius is greater than the maximum radius set.

param.name: ArduPlane:WP_LOITER_RAD
param.documentation: Defines the distance from the waypoint center, the plane will maintain during a loiter. If you set this value to a negative number then the default loiter direction will be counter-clockwise instead of clockwise.

param.name: ArduPlane:RTL_RADIUS
param.documentation: Defines the radius of the loiter circle when in RTL mode. If this is zero then WP_LOITER_RAD is used. If the radius is negative then a counter-clockwise is used. If positive then a clockwise loiter is used.

param.name: ArduPlane:FENCE_ACTION
param.documentation: What to do on fence breach. If this is set to 0 then no action is taken, and geofencing is disabled. If this is set to 1 then the plane will enter GUIDED mode, with the target waypoint as the fence return point. If this is set to 2 then the fence breach is reported to the ground station, but no other action is taken. If set to 3 then the plane enters guided mode but the pilot retains manual throttle control. If set to 4 the plane enters RTL mode, with the target waypoint as the closest rally point (or home point if there are no rally points).

param.name: ArduPlane:FENCE_TOTAL
param.documentation: Number of geofence points currently loaded

param.name: ArduPlane:FENCE_CHANNEL
param.documentation: RC Channel to use to enable geofence. PWM input above 1750 enables the geofence

param.name: ArduPlane:FENCE_MINALT
param.documentation: Minimum altitude allowed before geofence triggers

param.name: ArduPlane:FENCE_MAXALT
param.documentation: Maximum altitude allowed before geofence triggers

param.name: ArduPlane:FENCE_RETALT
param.documentation: Altitude the aircraft will transit to when a fence breach occurs. If FENCE_RETALT is <= 0 then the midpoint between FENCE_MAXALT and FENCE_MINALT is used, unless FENCE_MAXALT < FENCE_MINALT. If FENCE_MAXALT < FENCE_MINALT AND FENCE_RETALT is <= 0 then ALT_HOLD_RTL is the altitude used on a fence breach.

param.name: ArduPlane:FENCE_AUTOENABLE
param.documentation: When set to 1, geofence automatically enables after an auto takeoff and automatically disables at the beginning of an auto landing. When on the ground before takeoff the fence is disabled. When set to 2, the fence autoenables after an auto takeoff, but only disables the fence floor during landing. It is highly recommended to not use this option for line of sight flying and use a fence enable channel instead.

param.name: ArduPlane:FENCE_RET_RALLY
param.documentation: When set to 1: on fence breach the plane will return to the nearest rally point rather than the fence return point. If no rally points have been defined the plane will return to the home point.

param.name: ArduPlane:STALL_PREVENTION
param.documentation: This controls the use of stall prevention techniques, including roll limits at low speed and raising the minimum airspeed in turns. The limits are based on the aerodynamic load factor of a banked turn. This option relies on the correct ARSPD_FBW_MIN value being set correctly. Note that if you don't have an airspeed sensor then stall prevention will use an airspeed estimate based on the ground speed plus a wind estimate taken from the response of the autopilot banked turns. That synthetic airspeed estimate may be inaccurate, so you should not assume that stall prevention with no airspeed sensor will be effective.

param.name: ArduPlane:ARSPD_FBW_MIN
param.documentation: This is the minimum airspeed you want to fly at in modes where the autopilot controls the airspeed. This should be set to a value around 20% higher than the level flight stall speed for the airframe. This value is also used in the STALL_PREVENTION code.

param.name: ArduPlane:ARSPD_FBW_MAX
param.documentation: This is the maximum airspeed that you want to allow for your airframe in auto-throttle modes. You should ensure that this value is sufficiently above the ARSPD_FBW_MIN value to allow for a sufficient flight envelope to accurately control altitude using airspeed. A value at least 50% above ARSPD_FBW_MIN is recommended.

param.name: ArduPlane:FBWB_ELEV_REV
param.documentation: Reverse sense of elevator in FBWB and CRUISE modes. When set to 0 up elevator (pulling back on the stick) means to lower altitude. When set to 1, up elevator means to raise altitude.

param.name: ArduPlane:TERRAIN_FOLLOW
param.documentation: This enables terrain following for CRUISE mode, FBWB mode, RTL and for rally points. To use this option you also need to set TERRAIN_ENABLE to 1, which enables terrain data fetching from the GCS, and you need to have a GCS that supports sending terrain data to the aircraft. When terrain following is enabled then CRUISE and FBWB mode will hold height above terrain rather than height above home. In RTL the return to launch altitude will be considered to be a height above the terrain. Rally point altitudes will be taken as height above the terrain. This option does not affect mission items, which have a per-waypoint flag for whether they are height above home or height above the terrain. To use terrain following missions you need a ground station which can set the waypoint type to be a terrain height waypoint when creating the mission.

param.name: ArduPlane:TERRAIN_LOOKAHD
param.documentation: This controls how far ahead the terrain following code looks to ensure it stays above upcoming terrain. A value of zero means no lookahead, so the controller will track only the terrain directly below the aircraft. The lookahead will never extend beyond the next waypoint when in AUTO mode.

param.humanName: Fly By Wire B altitude change rate
param.name: ArduPlane:FBWB_CLIMB_RATE
param.documentation: This sets the rate in m/s at which FBWB and CRUISE modes will change its target altitude for full elevator deflection. Note that the actual climb rate of the aircraft can be lower than this, depending on your airspeed and throttle control settings. If you have this parameter set to the default value of 2.0, then holding the elevator at maximum deflection for 10 seconds would change the target altitude by 20 meters.

param.name: ArduPlane:THR_MIN
param.documentation: The minimum throttle setting (as a percentage) which the autopilot will apply. For the final stage of an automatic landing this is always zero. If your ESC supports reverse, use a negative value to configure for reverse thrust.

param.name: ArduPlane:THR_MAX
param.documentation: The maximum throttle setting (as a percentage) which the autopilot will apply.

param.name: ArduPlane:TKOFF_THR_MAX
param.documentation: The maximum throttle setting during automatic takeoff. If this is zero then THR_MAX is used for takeoff as well.

param.name: ArduPlane:THR_SLEWRATE
param.documentation: maximum percentage change in throttle per second. A setting of 10 means to not change the throttle by more than 10% of the full throttle range in one second.

param.name: ArduPlane:FLAP_SLEWRATE
param.documentation: maximum percentage change in flap output per second. A setting of 25 means to not change the flap by more than 25% of the full flap range in one second. A value of 0 means no rate limiting.

param.name: ArduPlane:THR_SUPP_MAN
param.documentation: When throttle is suppressed in auto mode it is normally forced to zero. If you enable this option, then while suppressed it will be manual throttle. This is useful on petrol engines to hold the idle throttle manually while waiting for takeoff

param.name: ArduPlane:THR_PASS_STAB
param.documentation: If this is set then when in STABILIZE, FBWA or ACRO modes the throttle is a direct passthru from the transmitter. This means the THR_MIN and THR_MAX settings are not used in these modes. This is useful for petrol engines where you setup a throttle cut switch that suppresses the throttle below the normal minimum.

param.name: ArduPlane:THR_FAILSAFE
param.documentation: The throttle failsafe allows you to configure a software failsafe activated by a setting on the throttle input channel

param.name: ArduPlane:THR_FS_VALUE
param.documentation: The PWM level on channel 3 below which throttle failsafe triggers

param.name: ArduPlane:TRIM_THROTTLE
param.documentation: The target percentage of throttle to apply for normal flight

param.name: ArduPlane:THROTTLE_NUDGE
param.documentation: When enabled, this uses the throttle input in auto-throttle modes to 'nudge' the throttle or airspeed to higher or lower values. When you have an airspeed sensor the nudge affects the target airspeed, so that throttle inputs above 50% will increase the target airspeed from TRIM_ARSPD_CM up to a maximum of ARSPD_FBW_MAX. When no airspeed sensor is enabled the throttle nudge will push up the target throttle for throttle inputs above 50%.

param.name: ArduPlane:FS_SHORT_ACTN
param.documentation: The action to take on a short (FS_SHORT_TIMEOUT) failsafe event. A short failsafe even can be triggered either by loss of RC control (see THR_FS_VALUE) or by loss of GCS control (see FS_GCS_ENABL). If in CIRCLE or RTL mode this parameter is ignored. A short failsafe event in stabilization and manual modes will cause an change to CIRCLE mode if FS_SHORT_ACTN is 0 or 1, and a change to FBWA mode if FS_SHORT_ACTN is 2. In all other modes (AUTO, GUIDED and LOITER) a short failsafe event will cause no mode change is FS_SHORT_ACTN is set to 0, will cause a change to CIRCLE mode if set to 1 and will change to FBWA mode if set to 2. Please see the documentation for FS_LONG_ACTN for the behaviour after FS_LONG_TIMEOUT seconds of failsafe.

param.name: ArduPlane:FS_SHORT_TIMEOUT
param.documentation: The time in seconds that a failsafe condition has to persist before a short failsafe event will occur. This defaults to 1.5 seconds

param.name: ArduPlane:FS_LONG_ACTN
param.documentation: The action to take on a long (FS_LONG_TIMEOUT seconds) failsafe event. If the aircraft was in a stabilization or manual mode when failsafe started and a long failsafe occurs then it will change to RTL mode if FS_LONG_ACTN is 0 or 1, and will change to FBWA if FS_LONG_ACTN is set to 2. If the aircraft was in an auto mode (such as AUTO or GUIDED) when the failsafe started then it will continue in the auto mode if FS_LONG_ACTN is set to 0, will change to RTL mode if FS_LONG_ACTN is set to 1 and will change to FBWA mode if FS_LONG_ACTN is set to 2. If FS_LONG_ACTION is set to 3, the parachute will be deployed (make sure the chute is configured and enabled).

param.name: ArduPlane:FS_LONG_TIMEOUT
param.documentation: The time in seconds that a failsafe condition has to persist before a long failsafe event will occur. This defaults to 5 seconds.

param.name: ArduPlane:FS_BATT_VOLTAGE
param.documentation: Battery voltage to trigger failsafe. Set to 0 to disable battery voltage failsafe. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for 10 seconds then the plane will switch to RTL mode.

param.name: ArduPlane:FS_BATT_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining to trigger failsafe. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery remaining drops below this level then the plane will switch to RTL mode immediately.

param.name: ArduPlane:FS_GCS_ENABL
param.documentation: Enable ground control station telemetry failsafe. Failsafe will trigger after FS_LONG_TIMEOUT seconds of no MAVLink heartbeat messages. There are two possible enabled settings. Seeing FS_GCS_ENABL to 1 means that GCS failsafe will be triggered when the aircraft has not received a MAVLink HEARTBEAT message. Setting FS_GCS_ENABL to 2 means that GCS failsafe will be triggered on either a loss of HEARTBEAT messages, or a RADIO_STATUS message from a MAVLink enabled 3DR radio indicating that the ground station is not receiving status updates from the aircraft, which is indicated by the RADIO_STATUS.remrssi field being zero (this may happen if you have a one way link due to asymmetric noise on the ground station and aircraft radios).Setting FS_GCS_ENABL to 3 means that GCS failsafe will be triggered by Heartbeat(like option one), but only in AUTO mode. WARNING: Enabling this option opens up the possibility of your plane going into failsafe mode and running the motor on the ground it it loses contact with your ground station. If this option is enabled on an electric plane then you should enable ARMING_REQUIRED.

param.name: ArduPlane:FLTMODE_CH
param.documentation: RC Channel to use for flight mode control

param.name: ArduPlane:FLTMODE1
param.documentation: Flight mode for switch position 1 (910 to 1230 and above 2049)

param.name: ArduPlane:FLTMODE2
param.documentation: Flight mode for switch position 2 (1231 to 1360)

param.name: ArduPlane:FLTMODE3
param.documentation: Flight mode for switch position 3 (1361 to 1490)

param.name: ArduPlane:FLTMODE4
param.documentation: Flight mode for switch position 4 (1491 to 1620)

param.name: ArduPlane:FLTMODE5
param.documentation: Flight mode for switch position 5 (1621 to 1749)

param.name: ArduPlane:FLTMODE6
param.documentation: Flight mode for switch position 6 (1750 to 2049)

param.name: ArduPlane:INITIAL_MODE
param.documentation: This selects the mode to start in on boot. This is useful for when you want to start in AUTO mode on boot without a receiver.

param.name: ArduPlane:LIM_ROLL_CD
param.documentation: The maximum commanded bank angle in either direction

param.name: ArduPlane:LIM_PITCH_MAX
param.documentation: The maximum commanded pitch up angle

param.name: ArduPlane:LIM_PITCH_MIN
param.documentation: The minimum commanded pitch down angle

param.name: ArduPlane:ACRO_ROLL_RATE
param.documentation: The maximum roll rate at full stick deflection in ACRO mode

param.name: ArduPlane:ACRO_PITCH_RATE
param.documentation: The maximum pitch rate at full stick deflection in ACRO mode

param.name: ArduPlane:ACRO_LOCKING
param.documentation: Enable attitude locking when sticks are released

param.name: ArduPlane:GROUND_STEER_ALT
param.documentation: Altitude at which to use the ground steering controller on the rudder. If non-zero then the STEER2SRV controller will be used to control the rudder for altitudes within this limit of the home altitude.

param.name: ArduPlane:GROUND_STEER_DPS
param.documentation: Ground steering rate in degrees per second for full rudder stick deflection

param.name: ArduPlane:TRIM_AUTO
param.documentation: Set RC trim PWM levels to current levels when switching away from manual mode. When this option is enabled and you change from MANUAL to any other mode then the APM will take the current position of the control sticks as the trim values for aileron, elevator and rudder. It will use those to set RC1_TRIM, RC2_TRIM and RC4_TRIM. This option is disabled by default as if a pilot is not aware of this option and changes from MANUAL to another mode while control inputs are not centered then the trim could be changed to a dangerously bad value. You can enable this option to assist with trimming your plane, by enabling it before takeoff then switching briefly to MANUAL in flight, and seeing how the plane reacts. You can then switch back to FBWA, trim the surfaces then again test MANUAL mode. Each time you switch from MANUAL the APM will take your control inputs as the new trim. After you have good trim on your aircraft you can disable TRIM_AUTO for future flights.

param.name: ArduPlane:ELEVON_MIXING
param.documentation: This enables an older form of elevon mixing which is now deprecated. Please see the ELEVON_OUTPUT option for setting up elevons. The ELEVON_MIXING option should be set to 0 for elevon planes except for backwards compatibility with older setups.

param.name: ArduPlane:ELEVON_REVERSE
param.documentation: Reverse elevon mixing

param.name: ArduPlane:ELEVON_CH1_REV
param.documentation: Reverse elevon channel 1

param.name: ArduPlane:ELEVON_CH2_REV
param.documentation: Reverse elevon channel 2

param.name: ArduPlane:VTAIL_OUTPUT
param.documentation: Enable VTail output in software. If enabled then the APM will provide software VTail mixing on the elevator and rudder channels. There are 8 different mixing modes available, which refer to the 8 ways the elevator can be mapped to the two VTail servos. Please also see the MIXING_GAIN parameter for the output gain of the mixer.

param.name: ArduPlane:ELEVON_OUTPUT
param.documentation: Enable software elevon output mixer. If enabled then the APM will provide software elevon mixing on the aileron and elevator channels. There are 8 different mixing modes available, which refer to the 8 ways the elevator can be mapped to the two elevon servos. Please also see the MIXING_GAIN parameter for the output gain of the mixer.

param.name: ArduPlane:MIXING_GAIN
param.documentation: The gain for the Vtail and elevon output mixers. The default is 0.5, which ensures that the mixer doesn't saturate, allowing both input channels to go to extremes while retaining control over the output. Hardware mixers often have a 1.0 gain, which gives more servo throw, but can saturate. If you don't have enough throw on your servos with VTAIL_OUTPUT or ELEVON_OUTPUT enabled then you can raise the gain using MIXING_GAIN. The mixer allows outputs in the range 900 to 2100 microseconds.

param.name: ArduPlane:RUDDER_ONLY
param.documentation: Enable rudder only mode. The rudder will control attitude in attitude controlled modes (such as FBWA). You should setup your transmitter to send roll stick inputs to the RCMAP_YAW channel (normally channel 4). The rudder servo should be attached to the RCMAP_YAW channel as well. Note that automatic ground steering will be disabled for rudder only aircraft. You should also set KFF_RDDRMIX to 1.0. You will also need to setup the YAW2SRV_DAMP yaw damping appropriately for your aircraft. A value of 0.5 for YAW2SRV_DAMP is a good starting point.

param.name: ArduPlane:MIXING_OFFSET
param.documentation: The offset for the Vtail and elevon output mixers, as a percentage. This can be used in combination with MIXING_GAIN to configure how the control surfaces respond to input. The response to aileron or elevator input can be increased by setting this parameter to a positive or negative value. A common usage is to enter a positive value to increase the aileron response of the elevons of a flying wing. The default value of zero will leave the aileron-input response equal to the elevator-input response.

param.name: ArduPlane:DSPOILR_RUD_RATE
param.documentation: Sets the amount of deflection that the rudder output will apply to the differential spoilers, as a percentage. The default value of 100 results in full rudder applying full deflection. A value of 0 will result in the differential spoilers exactly following the elevons (no rudder effect).

param.name: ArduPlane:SYS_NUM_RESETS
param.documentation: Number of APM board resets

param.name: ArduPlane:LOG_BITMASK
param.documentation: Bitmap of what log types to enable in dataflash. This values is made up of the sum of each of the log types you want to be saved on dataflash. On a PX4 or Pixhawk the large storage size of a microSD card means it is usually best just to enable all log types by setting this to 65535. On APM2 the smaller 4 MByte dataflash means you need to be more selective in your logging or you may run out of log space while flying (in which case it will wrap and overwrite the start of the log). The individual bits are ATTITUDE_FAST=1, ATTITUDE_MEDIUM=2, GPS=4, PerformanceMonitoring=8, ControlTuning=16, NavigationTuning=32, Mode=64, IMU=128, Commands=256, Battery=512, Compass=1024, TECS=2048, Camera=4096, RCandServo=8192, Sonar=16384, Arming=32768, FullLogs=65535

param.name: ArduPlane:RST_SWITCH_CH
param.documentation: RC channel to use to reset to last flight mode after geofence takeover.

param.name: ArduPlane:RST_MISSION_CH
param.documentation: RC channel to use to reset the mission to the first waypoint. When this channel goes above 1750 the mission is reset. Set RST_MISSION_CH to 0 to disable.

param.name: ArduPlane:TRIM_ARSPD_CM
param.documentation: Airspeed in cm/s to aim for when airspeed is enabled in auto mode. This is a calibrated (apparent) airspeed.

param.humanName: speed used for speed scaling calculations
param.name: ArduPlane:SCALING_SPEED
param.documentation: Airspeed in m/s to use when calculating surface speed scaling. Note that changing this value will affect all PID values

param.name: ArduPlane:MIN_GNDSPD_CM
param.documentation: Minimum ground speed in cm/s when under airspeed control

param.name: ArduPlane:TRIM_PITCH_CD
param.documentation: offset to add to pitch - used for in-flight pitch trimming. It is recommended that instead of using this parameter you level your plane correctly on the ground for good flight attitude.

param.name: ArduPlane:ALT_HOLD_RTL
param.documentation: Return to launch target altitude. This is the relative altitude the plane will aim for and loiter at when returning home. If this is negative (usually -1) then the plane will use the current altitude at the time of entering RTL. Note that when transiting to a Rally Point the altitude of the Rally Point is used instead of ALT_HOLD_RTL.

param.name: ArduPlane:ALT_HOLD_FBWCM
param.documentation: This is the minimum altitude in centimeters that FBWB and CRUISE modes will allow. If you attempt to descend below this altitude then the plane will level off. A value of zero means no limit.

param.name: ArduPlane:MAG_ENABLE
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the compass. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the compass. Note that this is separate from COMPASS_USE. This will enable the low level senor, and will enable logging of magnetometer data. To use the compass for navigation you must also set COMPASS_USE to 1.

param.name: ArduPlane:FLAP_IN_CHANNEL
param.documentation: An RC input channel to use for flaps control. If this is set to a RC channel number then that channel will be used for manual flaps control. When enabled, the percentage of flaps is taken as the percentage travel from the TRIM value of the channel to the MIN value of the channel. A value above the TRIM values will give inverse flaps (spoilers). This option needs to be enabled in conjunction with a FUNCTION setting on an output channel to one of the flap functions. When a FLAP_IN_CHANNEL is combined with auto-flaps the higher of the two flap percentages is taken. You must also enable a FLAPERON_OUTPUT flaperon mixer setting if using flaperons.

param.name: ArduPlane:FLAPERON_OUTPUT
param.documentation: Enable flaperon output in software. If enabled then the APM will provide software flaperon mixing on the FLAPERON1 and FLAPERON2 output channels specified using the FUNCTION on two auxiliary channels. There are 8 different mixing modes available, which refer to the 8 ways the flap and aileron outputs can be mapped to the two flaperon servos. Please also see the MIXING_GAIN parameter for the output gain of the mixer. FLAPERON_OUTPUT cannot be combined with ELEVON_OUTPUT or ELEVON_MIXING.

param.name: ArduPlane:FLAP_1_PERCNT
param.documentation: The percentage change in flap position when FLAP_1_SPEED is reached. Use zero to disable flaps

param.name: ArduPlane:FLAP_1_SPEED
param.documentation: The speed in meters per second at which to engage FLAP_1_PERCENT of flaps. Note that FLAP_1_SPEED should be greater than or equal to FLAP_2_SPEED

param.name: ArduPlane:FLAP_2_PERCNT
param.documentation: The percentage change in flap position when FLAP_2_SPEED is reached. Use zero to disable flaps

param.name: ArduPlane:FLAP_2_SPEED
param.documentation: The speed in meters per second at which to engage FLAP_2_PERCENT of flaps. Note that FLAP_1_SPEED should be greater than or equal to FLAP_2_SPEED

param.name: ArduPlane:OVERRIDE_CHAN
param.documentation: If set to a non-zero value then this is an RC input channel number to use for giving PX4IO manual control in case the main FMU microcontroller on a PX4 or Pixhawk fails. When this RC input channel goes above 1750 the FMU microcontroller will no longer be involved in controlling the servos and instead the PX4IO microcontroller will directly control the servos. Note that PX4IO manual control will be automatically activated if the FMU crashes for any reason. This parameter allows you to test for correct manual behaviour without actually crashing the FMU. This parameter is can be set to a non-zero value either for ground testing purposes or for giving the effect of an external override control board. Please also see the docs on OVERRIDE_SAFETY. Note that you may set OVERRIDE_CHAN to the same channel as FLTMODE_CH to get PX4IO based override when in flight mode 6. Note that when override is triggered due to a FMU crash the 6 auxiliary output channels on Pixhawk will no longer be updated, so all the flight controls you need must be assigned to the first 8 channels.

param.name: ArduPlane:OVERRIDE_SAFETY
param.documentation: This controls whether the safety switch is turned off when you activate override with OVERRIDE_CHAN. When set to 1 the safety switch is de-activated (activating the servos) then a PX4IO override is triggered. In that case the safety remains de-activated after override is disabled. If OVERRIDE_SAFETTY is set to 0 then the safety switch state does not change. Note that regardless of the value of this parameter the servos will be active while override is active.

param.name: ArduPlane:INVERTEDFLT_CH
param.documentation: A RC input channel number to enable inverted flight. If this is non-zero then the APM will monitor the corresponding RC input channel and will enable inverted flight when the channel goes above 1750.

param.name: ArduPlane:HIL_MODE
param.documentation: This enables and disables hardware in the loop mode. If HIL_MODE is 1 then on the next reboot all sensors are replaced with HIL sensors which come from the GCS.

param.name: ArduPlane:HIL_SERVOS
param.documentation: This controls whether real servo controls are used in HIL mode. If you enable this then the APM will control the real servos in HIL mode. If disabled it will report servo values, but will not output to the real servos. Be careful that your motor and propeller are not connected if you enable this option.

param.humanName: Limit of error in HIL attitude before reset
param.name: ArduPlane:HIL_ERR_LIMIT
param.documentation: This controls the maximum error in degrees on any axis before HIL will reset the DCM attitude to match the HIL_STATE attitude. This limit will prevent poor timing on HIL from causing a major attitude error. If the value is zero then no limit applies.

param.name: ArduPlane:RTL_AUTOLAND
param.documentation: Automatically begin landing sequence after arriving at RTL location. This requires the addition of a DO_LAND_START mission item, which acts as a marker for the start of a landing sequence. The closest landing sequence will be chosen to the current location.

values.value: Enable - go directly to landing sequence

param.humanName: RC Trims auto set at start.
param.name: ArduPlane:RC_TRIM_AT_START
param.documentation: Automatically set roll/pitch trim from Tx at ground start. This makes the assumption that the RC transmitter has not been altered since trims were last captured.

param.name: ArduPlane:CRASH_ACC_THRESH
param.documentation: X-Axis deceleration threshold to notify the crash detector that there was a possible impact which helps disarm the motor quickly after a crash. This value should be much higher than normal negative x-axis forces during normal flight, check flight log files to determine the average IMU.x values for your aircraft and motor type. Higher value means less sensative (triggers on higher impact). For electric planes that don't vibrate much during fight a value of 25 is good (that's about 2.5G). For petrol/nitro planes you'll want a higher value. Set to 0 to disable the collision detector.

param.name: ArduPlane:CRASH_DETECT
param.documentation: Automatically detect a crash during AUTO flight and perform the bitmask selected action(s). Disarm will turn off motor for safety and to help against burning out ESC and motor. Setting the mode to manual will help save the servos from burning out by overexerting if the aircraft crashed in an odd orientation such as upsidedown. Set to 0 to disable crash detection.

param.name: ArduPlane:CHUTE_CHAN
param.documentation: If set to a non-zero value then this is an RC input channel number to use for manually releasing the parachute. When this channel goes above 1700 the parachute will be released

param.name: ArduPlane:RNGFND_LANDING
param.documentation: This enables the use of a rangefinder for automatic landing. The rangefinder will be used both on the landing approach and for final flare

param.name: ArduPlane:SYSID_ENFORCE
param.documentation: This controls whether packets from other than the expected GCS system ID will be accepted

param.name: ArduPlane:RUDD_DT_GAIN
param.documentation: gain control from rudder to differential thrust

param.name: ArduCopter:SYSID_SW_MREV
param.documentation: This value is incremented when changes are made to the eeprom format

param.name: ArduCopter:SYSID_SW_TYPE
param.documentation: This is used by the ground station to recognise the software type (eg ArduPlane vs ArduCopter)

param.humanName: MAVLink system ID of this vehicle
param.name: ArduCopter:SYSID_THISMAV
param.documentation: Allows setting an individual MAVLink system id for this vehicle to distinguish it from others on the same network

param.name: ArduCopter:SYSID_MYGCS
param.documentation: Allows restricting radio overrides to only come from my ground station

param.name: ArduCopter:CLI_ENABLED
param.documentation: This enables/disables the checking for three carriage returns on telemetry links on startup to enter the diagnostics command line interface

param.name: ArduCopter:PILOT_THR_FILT
param.documentation: Throttle filter cutoff (Hz) - active whenever altitude control is inactive - 0 to disable

param.name: ArduCopter:PILOT_TKOFF_ALT
param.documentation: Altitude that altitude control modes will climb to when a takeoff is triggered with the throttle stick.

param.name: ArduCopter:PILOT_TKOFF_DZ
param.documentation: Offset from mid stick at which takeoff is triggered

param.name: ArduCopter:PILOT_THR_BHV
param.documentation: Bitmask containing various throttle stick options. Add up the values for options that you want.
param.field: 0:Feedback from mid stick,1:High throttle cancels landing,2:Disarm on land detection

param.name: ArduCopter:TELEM_DELAY
param.documentation: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

param.name: ArduCopter:GCS_PID_MASK
param.documentation: bitmask of PIDs to send MAVLink PID_TUNING messages for

param.name: ArduCopter:RTL_ALT
param.documentation: The minimum relative altitude the model will move to before Returning to Launch. Set to zero to return at current altitude.

param.name: ArduCopter:RTL_CONE_SLOPE
param.documentation: Defines a cone above home which determines maximum climb

param.name: ArduCopter:RTL_SPEED
param.documentation: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain horizontally while flying home. If this is set to zero, WPNAV_SPEED will be used instead.

param.name: ArduCopter:RNGFND_GAIN
param.documentation: Used to adjust the speed with which the target altitude is changed when objects are sensed below the copter

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_BATT_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls whether failsafe will be invoked when battery voltage or current runs low

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_BATT_VOLTAGE
param.documentation: Battery voltage to trigger failsafe. Set to 0 to disable battery voltage failsafe. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage then the copter will RTL

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_BATT_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining to trigger failsafe. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery remaining drops below this level then the copter will RTL

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_GCS_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls whether failsafe will be invoked (and what action to take) when connection with Ground station is lost for at least 5 seconds. NB. The GCS Failsafe is only active when RC_OVERRIDE is being used to control the vehicle.

values.value: Enabled Continue with Mission in Auto Mode

param.name: ArduCopter:GPS_HDOP_GOOD
param.documentation: GPS Hdop value at or below this value represent a good position. Used for pre-arm checks

param.name: ArduCopter:MAG_ENABLE
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the compass. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the compass

param.name: ArduCopter:SUPER_SIMPLE
param.documentation: Bitmask to enable Super Simple mode for some flight modes. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable Super Simple Mode

param.name: ArduCopter:RTL_ALT_FINAL
param.documentation: This is the altitude the vehicle will move to as the final stage of Returning to Launch or after completing a mission. Set to zero to land.

param.name: ArduCopter:RTL_CLIMB_MIN
param.documentation: The vehicle will climb this many cm during the initial climb portion of the RTL

param.name: ArduCopter:WP_YAW_BEHAVIOR
param.documentation: Determines how the autopilot controls the yaw during missions and RTL

param.name: ArduCopter:RTL_LOIT_TIME
param.documentation: Time (in milliseconds) to loiter above home before beginning final descent

param.name: ArduCopter:LAND_SPEED
param.documentation: The descent speed for the final stage of landing in cm/s

param.name: ArduCopter:LAND_SPEED_HIGH
param.documentation: The descent speed for the first stage of landing in cm/s. If this is zero then WPNAV_SPEED_DN is used

param.name: ArduCopter:PILOT_VELZ_MAX
param.documentation: The maximum vertical velocity the pilot may request in cm/s

param.name: ArduCopter:PILOT_ACCEL_Z
param.documentation: The vertical acceleration used when pilot is controlling the altitude

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_THR_ENABLE
param.documentation: The throttle failsafe allows you to configure a software failsafe activated by a setting on the throttle input channel

values.value: Enabled Continue with Mission in Auto Mode

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_THR_VALUE
param.documentation: The PWM level on channel 3 below which throttle failsafe triggers

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_DZ
param.documentation: The deadzone above and below mid throttle. Used in AltHold, Loiter, PosHold flight modes

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE1
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is <= 1230

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE2
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1230, <= 1360

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE3
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1360, <= 1490

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE4
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1490, <= 1620

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE5
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1620, <= 1749

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE6
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >=1750

param.name: ArduCopter:SIMPLE
param.documentation: Bitmask which holds which flight modes use simple heading mode (eg bit 0 = 1 means Flight Mode 0 uses simple mode)

param.name: ArduCopter:LOG_BITMASK
param.documentation: 4 byte bitmap of log types to enable

param.name: ArduCopter:ESC_CALIBRATION
param.documentation: Controls whether ArduCopter will enter ESC calibration on the next restart. Do not adjust this parameter manually.

values.value: Start-up in ESC Calibration mode if throttle high
Start-up in ESC Calibration mode regardless of throttle

param.name: ArduCopter:TUNE
param.documentation: Controls which parameters (normally PID gains) are being tuned with transmitter's channel 6 knob

param.name: ArduCopter:TUNE_LOW
param.documentation: The minimum value that will be applied to the parameter currently being tuned with the transmitter's channel 6 knob

param.name: ArduCopter:TUNE_HIGH
param.documentation: The maximum value that will be applied to the parameter currently being tuned with the transmitter's channel 6 knob

param.name: ArduCopter:FRAME_TYPE
param.documentation: Controls motor mixing for multicopters. Not used for Tri or Traditional Helicopters.

param.name: ArduCopter:CH7_OPT
param.documentation: Select which function is performed when CH7 is above 1800 pwm

param.name: ArduCopter:CH8_OPT
param.documentation: Select which function is performed when CH8 is above 1800 pwm

param.name: ArduCopter:CH9_OPT
param.documentation: Select which function is performed when CH9 is above 1800 pwm

param.name: ArduCopter:CH10_OPT
param.documentation: Select which function is performed when CH10 is above 1800 pwm

param.name: ArduCopter:CH11_OPT
param.documentation: Select which function is performed when CH11 is above 1800 pwm

param.name: ArduCopter:CH12_OPT
param.documentation: Select which function is performed when CH12 is above 1800 pwm

param.name: ArduCopter:DISARM_DELAY
param.documentation: Delay before automatic disarm in seconds. A value of zero disables auto disarm.

param.name: ArduCopter:ANGLE_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum lean angle in all flight modes

param.name: ArduCopter:RC_FEEL_RP
param.documentation: RC feel for roll/pitch which controls vehicle response to user input with 0 being extremely soft and 100 being crisp

param.name: ArduCopter:PHLD_BRAKE_RATE
param.documentation: PosHold flight mode's rotation rate during braking in deg/sec

param.name: ArduCopter:PHLD_BRAKE_ANGLE
param.documentation: PosHold flight mode's max lean angle during braking in centi-degrees

param.name: ArduCopter:LAND_REPOSITION
param.documentation: Enables user input during LAND mode, the landing phase of RTL, and auto mode landings.

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_EKF_ACTION
param.documentation: Controls the action that will be taken when an EKF failsafe is invoked

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_EKF_THRESH
param.documentation: Allows setting the maximum acceptable compass and velocity variance

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_CRASH_CHECK
param.documentation: This enables automatic crash checking. When enabled the motors will disarm if a crash is detected.

param.name: ArduCopter:RC_SPEED
param.documentation: This is the speed in Hertz that your ESCs will receive updates

param.humanName: Acro Roll and Pitch P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_RP_P
param.documentation: Converts pilot roll and pitch into a desired rate of rotation in ACRO and SPORT mode. Higher values mean faster rate of rotation.

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_YAW_P
param.documentation: Converts pilot yaw input into a desired rate of rotation in ACRO, Stabilize and SPORT modes. Higher values mean faster rate of rotation.

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_BAL_ROLL
param.documentation: rate at which roll angle returns to level in acro mode. A higher value causes the vehicle to return to level faster.

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_BAL_PITCH
param.documentation: rate at which pitch angle returns to level in acro mode. A higher value causes the vehicle to return to level faster.

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_TRAINER
param.documentation: Type of trainer used in acro mode

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_RP_EXPO
param.documentation: Acro roll/pitch Expo to allow faster rotation when stick at edges

param.name: ArduCopter:VEL_XY_P
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) P gain. Converts the difference between desired velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: ArduCopter:VEL_XY_I
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: ArduCopter:VEL_XY_IMAX
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) integrator maximum. Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

param.name: ArduCopter:VEL_Z_P
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical speed and actual speed into a desired acceleration that is passed to the throttle acceleration controller

param.name: ArduCopter:ACCEL_Z_P
param.documentation: Throttle acceleration controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration into a motor output

param.name: ArduCopter:ACCEL_Z_I
param.documentation: Throttle acceleration controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration

param.humanName: Throttle acceleration controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:ACCEL_Z_IMAX
param.documentation: Throttle acceleration controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pwm that the I term will generate

param.name: ArduCopter:ACCEL_Z_D
param.documentation: Throttle acceleration controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired vertical acceleration vs actual acceleration

param.name: ArduCopter:ACCEL_Z_FILT
param.documentation: Filter applied to acceleration to reduce noise. Lower values reduce noise but add delay.

param.name: ArduCopter:POS_Z_P
param.documentation: Position (vertical) controller P gain. Converts the difference between the desired altitude and actual altitude into a climb or descent rate which is passed to the throttle rate controller

param.name: ArduCopter:POS_XY_P
param.documentation: Loiter position controller P gain. Converts the distance (in the latitude direction) to the target location into a desired speed which is then passed to the loiter latitude rate controller

param.name: ArduCopter:AUTOTUNE_AXES
param.documentation: 1-byte bitmap of axes to autotune

param.name: ArduCopter:AUTOTUNE_AGGR
param.documentation: Autotune aggressiveness. Defines the bounce back used to detect size of the D term.

param.name: ArduCopter:AUTOTUNE_MIN_D
param.documentation: Defines the minimum D gain

param.humanName: Start motors before throwing is detected
param.name: ArduCopter:THROW_MOT_START
param.documentation: Used by THROW mode. Controls whether motors will run at the speed set by THR_MIN or will be stopped when armed and waiting for the throw.

param.name: ArduCopter:TERRAIN_FOLLOW
param.documentation: This enables terrain following for RTL and LAND flight modes. To use this option TERRAIN_ENABLE must be 1 and the GCS must support sending terrain data to the aircraft. In RTL the RTL_ALT will be considered a height above the terrain. In LAND mode the vehicle will slow to LAND_SPEED 10m above terrain (instead of 10m above home). This parameter does not affect AUTO and Guided which use a per-command flag to determine if the height is above-home, absolute or above-terrain.

values.value: Do Not Use in RTL and Land

param.name: ArduCopter:WP_NAVALT_MIN
param.documentation: This is the altitude in meters above which for navigation can begin. This applies in auto takeoff and auto landing.

param.name: ArduCopter:THROW_NEXTMODE
param.documentation: Vehicle will switch to this mode after the throw is successfully completed. Default is to stay in throw mode (18)

param.name: ArduCopter:THROW_TYPE
param.documentation: Used by THROW mode. Specifies whether Copter is thrown upward or dropped.

param.name: ArduCopter:GND_EFFECT_COMP
param.documentation: Ground Effect Compensation Enable/Disable

param.name: ArduCopter:DEV_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Bitmask of developer options. The meanings of the bit fields in this parameter may vary at any time. Developers should check the source code for current meaning

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_Y_EXPO
param.documentation: Acro yaw expo to allow faster rotation when stick at edges

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_THR_MID
param.documentation: Acro Throttle Mid

param.name: ArduCopter:SYSID_ENFORCE
param.documentation: This controls whether packets from other than the expected GCS system ID will be accepted

param.name: ArduCopter:FRAME_CLASS
param.documentation: Controls major frame class for multicopter component

param.name: AntennaTracker:FORMAT_VERSION
param.documentation: This value is incremented when changes are made to the eeprom format

param.name: AntennaTracker:SYSID_SW_TYPE
param.documentation: This is used by the ground station to recognise the software type (eg ArduPlane vs ArduCopter)

param.humanName: MAVLink system ID of this vehicle
param.name: AntennaTracker:SYSID_THISMAV
param.documentation: Allows setting an individual system id for this vehicle to distinguish it from others on the same network

param.name: AntennaTracker:SYSID_MYGCS
param.documentation: The identifier of the ground station in the MAVLink protocol. Don't change this unless you also modify the ground station to match.

param.name: AntennaTracker:SYSID_TARGET
param.documentation: The identifier of the vehicle being tracked. This should be zero (to auto detect) or be the same as the SYSID_THISMAV parameter of the vehicle being tracked.

param.name: AntennaTracker:MAG_ENABLE
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the compass. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the compass. Note that this is separate from COMPASS_USE. This will enable the low level senor, and will enable logging of magnetometer data. To use the compass for navigation you must also set COMPASS_USE to 1.

param.humanName: Time for yaw to slew through its full range
param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW_SLEW_TIME
param.documentation: This controls how rapidly the tracker will change the servo output for yaw. It is set as the number of seconds to do a full rotation. You can use this parameter to slow the trackers movements, which may help with some types of trackers. A value of zero will allow for unlimited servo movement per update.

param.humanName: Time for pitch to slew through its full range
param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH_SLEW_TIME
param.documentation: This controls how rapidly the tracker will change the servo output for pitch. It is set as the number of seconds to do a full range of pitch movement. You can use this parameter to slow the trackers movements, which may help with some types of trackers. A value of zero will allow for unlimited servo movement per update.

param.humanName: Speed at which to rotate in scan mode
param.name: AntennaTracker:SCAN_SPEED
param.documentation: This controls how rapidly the tracker will move the servos in SCAN mode

param.humanName: Minimum time to apply a yaw reversal
param.name: AntennaTracker:MIN_REVERSE_TIME
param.documentation: When the tracker detects it has reached the limit of servo movement in yaw it will reverse and try moving to the other extreme of yaw. This parameter controls the minimum time it should reverse for. It is used to cope with trackers that have a significant lag in movement to ensure they do move all the way around.

param.name: AntennaTracker:START_LATITUDE
param.documentation: Combined with START_LONGITUDE this parameter allows for an initial position of the tracker to be set. This position will be used until the GPS gets lock. It can also be used to run a stationary tracker with no GPS attached.

param.name: AntennaTracker:START_LONGITUDE
param.documentation: Combined with START_LATITUDE this parameter allows for an initial position of the tracker to be set. This position will be used until the GPS gets lock. It can also be used to run a stationary tracker with no GPS attached.

param.humanName: Delay before first servo movement from trim
param.name: AntennaTracker:STARTUP_DELAY
param.documentation: This parameter can be used to force the servos to their trim value for a time on startup. This can help with some servo types

param.humanName: Type of servo system being used for pitch
param.name: AntennaTracker:SERVO_PITCH_TYPE
param.documentation: This allows selection of position servos or on/off servos for pitch

param.humanName: Type of servo system being used for yaw
param.name: AntennaTracker:SERVO_YAW_TYPE
param.documentation: This allows selection of position servos or on/off servos for yaw

param.name: AntennaTracker:ONOFF_YAW_RATE
param.documentation: Rate of change of yaw in degrees/second for on/off servos

param.name: AntennaTracker:ONOFF_PITCH_RATE
param.documentation: Rate of change of pitch in degrees/second for on/off servos

param.name: AntennaTracker:ONOFF_YAW_MINT
param.documentation: Minimum amount of time in seconds to move in yaw

param.name: AntennaTracker:ONOFF_PITCH_MINT
param.documentation: Minimim amount of time in seconds to move in pitch

param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW_TRIM
param.documentation: Amount of extra yaw to add when tracking. This allows for small adjustments for an out of trim compass.

param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH_TRIM
param.documentation: Amount of extra pitch to add when tracking. This allows for small adjustments for a badly calibrated barometer.

param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW_RANGE
param.documentation: Yaw axis total range of motion in degrees

param.name: AntennaTracker:DISTANCE_MIN
param.documentation: Tracker will track targets at least this distance away

param.name: AntennaTracker:ALT_SOURCE
param.documentation: What provides altitude information for vehicle. Vehicle only assumes tracker has same altitude as vehicle's home

param.name: AntennaTracker:MAV_UPDATE_RATE
param.documentation: The rate at which Mavlink updates position and baro data

param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH_MIN
param.documentation: The lowest angle the pitch can reach

param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH_MAX
param.documentation: The highest angle the pitch can reach

param.name: AntennaTracker:LOG_BITMASK
param.documentation: 4 byte bitmap of log types to enable

param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_P
param.documentation: Pitch axis controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired pitch angle and actual pitch angle into a pitch servo pwm change

param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_I
param.documentation: Pitch axis controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired pitch angle vs actual pitch angle

param.humanName: Pitch axis controller I gain maximum
param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_IMAX
param.documentation: Pitch axis controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pwm change that the I gain will output

param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_D
param.documentation: Pitch axis controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired pitch angle vs actual pitch angle

param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_P
param.documentation: Yaw axis controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired yaw angle (heading) and actual yaw angle into a yaw servo pwm change

param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_I
param.documentation: Yaw axis controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired yaw angle (heading) vs actual yaw angle

param.humanName: Yaw axis controller I gain maximum
param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_IMAX
param.documentation: Yaw axis controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pwm change that the I gain will output

param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_D
param.documentation: Yaw axis controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired yaw angle (heading) vs actual yaw angle

param.name: AntennaTracker:CMD_TOTAL
param.documentation: Set to 1 if HOME location has been loaded by the ground station. Do not change this manually.

param.name: APMrover2:FORMAT_VERSION
param.documentation: This value is incremented when changes are made to the eeprom format

param.name: APMrover2:SYSID_SW_TYPE
param.documentation: This is used by the ground station to recognise the software type (eg ArduPlane vs ArduCopter)

param.name: APMrover2:LOG_BITMASK
param.documentation: Bitmap of what log types to enable in dataflash. This values is made up of the sum of each of the log types you want to be saved on dataflash. On a PX4 or Pixhawk the large storage size of a microSD card means it is usually best just to enable all log types by setting this to 65535. On APM2 the smaller 4 MByte dataflash means you need to be more selective in your logging or you may run out of log space while flying (in which case it will wrap and overwrite the start of the log). The individual bits are ATTITUDE_FAST=1, ATTITUDE_MEDIUM=2, GPS=4, PerformanceMonitoring=8, ControlTuning=16, NavigationTuning=32, Mode=64, IMU=128, Commands=256, Battery=512, Compass=1024, TECS=2048, Camera=4096, RCandServo=8192, Sonar=16384, Arming=32768, FullLogs=65535

param.name: APMrover2:SYS_NUM_RESETS
param.documentation: Number of APM board resets

param.name: APMrover2:RST_SWITCH_CH
param.documentation: RC channel to use to reset to last flight mode after geofence takeover.

param.name: APMrover2:INITIAL_MODE
param.documentation: This selects the mode to start in on boot. This is useful for when you want to start in AUTO mode on boot without a receiver. Usually used in combination with when AUTO_TRIGGER_PIN or AUTO_KICKSTART.

param.humanName: MAVLink system ID of this vehicle
param.name: APMrover2:SYSID_THIS_MAV
param.documentation: Allows setting an individual MAVLink system id for this vehicle to distinguish it from others on the same network

param.name: APMrover2:SYSID_MYGCS
param.documentation: The identifier of the ground station in the MAVLink protocol. Don't change this unless you also modify the ground station to match.

param.name: APMrover2:CLI_ENABLED
param.documentation: This enables/disables the checking for three carriage returns on telemetry links on startup to enter the diagnostics command line interface

param.name: APMrover2:TELEM_DELAY
param.documentation: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

param.name: APMrover2:GCS_PID_MASK
param.documentation: bitmask of PIDs to send MAVLink PID_TUNING messages for

param.name: APMrover2:MAG_ENABLE
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the compass. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the compass. Note that this is separate from COMPASS_USE. This will enable the low level senor, and will enable logging of magnetometer data. To use the compass for navigation you must also set COMPASS_USE to 1.

param.name: APMrover2:AUTO_TRIGGER_PIN
param.documentation: pin number to use to enable the throttle in auto mode. If set to -1 then don't use a trigger, otherwise this is a pin number which if held low in auto mode will enable the motor to run. If the switch is released while in AUTO then the motor will stop again. This can be used in combination with INITIAL_MODE to give a 'press button to start' rover with no receiver.

param.name: APMrover2:AUTO_KICKSTART
param.documentation: X acceleration in meters/second/second to use to trigger the motor start in auto mode. If set to zero then auto throttle starts immediately when the mode switch happens, otherwise the rover waits for the X acceleration to go above this value before it will start the motor

param.humanName: Target cruise speed in auto modes
param.name: APMrover2:CRUISE_SPEED
param.documentation: The target speed in auto missions.

param.name: APMrover2:SPEED_TURN_GAIN
param.documentation: The percentage to reduce the throttle while turning. If this is 100% then the target speed is not reduced while turning. If this is 50% then the target speed is reduced in proportion to the turn rate, with a reduction of 50% when the steering is maximally deflected.

param.humanName: Distance to turn to start reducing speed
param.name: APMrover2:SPEED_TURN_DIST
param.documentation: The distance to the next turn at which the rover reduces its target speed by the SPEED_TURN_GAIN

param.name: APMrover2:BRAKING_PERCENT
param.documentation: The maximum reverse throttle braking percentage to apply when cornering

param.humanName: Speed error at which to apply braking
param.name: APMrover2:BRAKING_SPEEDERR
param.documentation: The amount of overspeed error at which to start applying braking

param.name: APMrover2:PIVOT_TURN_ANGLE
param.documentation: Navigation angle threshold in degrees to switch to pivot steering when SKID_STEER_OUT is 1. This allows you to setup a skid steering rover to turn on the spot in auto mode when the angle it needs to turn it greater than this angle. An angle of zero means to disable pivot turning. Note that you will probably also want to set a low value for WP_RADIUS to get neat turns.

param.name: APMrover2:CH7_OPTION
param.documentation: What to do use channel 7 for

param.name: APMrover2:THR_MIN
param.documentation: The minimum throttle setting to which the autopilot will apply. This is mostly useful for rovers with internal combustion motors, to prevent the motor from cutting out in auto mode.

param.name: APMrover2:THR_MAX
param.documentation: The maximum throttle setting to which the autopilot will apply. This can be used to prevent overheating a ESC or motor on an electric rover.

param.name: APMrover2:CRUISE_THROTTLE
param.documentation: The base throttle percentage to use in auto mode. The CRUISE_SPEED parameter controls the target speed, but the rover starts with the CRUISE_THROTTLE setting as the initial estimate for how much throttle is needed to achieve that speed. It then adjusts the throttle based on how fast the rover is actually going.

param.name: APMrover2:THR_SLEWRATE
param.documentation: maximum percentage change in throttle per second. A setting of 10 means to not change the throttle by more than 10% of the full throttle range in one second.
