param.name: COMPASS_CAL_FIT
param.documentation: This controls the fitness level required for a successful compass calibration. A lower value makes for a stricter fit (less likely to pass). This is the value used for the primary magnetometer. Other magnetometers get double the value.

param.name: COMPASS_OFFS_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum allowed compass offset in calibration and arming checks

param.name: EK2_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables EKF2. Enabling EKF2 only makes the maths run, it does not mean it will be used for flight control. To use it for flight control set AHRS_EKF_TYPE=2. A reboot or restart will need to be performed after changing the value of EK2_ENABLE for it to take effect.

param.name: EK2_GPS_TYPE
param.documentation: This controls use of GPS measurements : 0 = use 3D velocity & 2D position, 1 = use 2D velocity and 2D position, 2 = use 2D position, 3 = Inhibit GPS use - this can be useful when flying with an optical flow sensor in an environment where GPS quality is poor and subject to large multipath errors.

param.name: EK2_VELNE_M_NSE
param.documentation: This sets a lower limit on the speed accuracy reported by the GPS receiver that is used to set horizontal velocity observation noise. If the model of receiver used does not provide a speed accurcy estimate, then the parameter value will be used. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the GPS horizontal velocity measurements.

param.name: EK2_VELD_M_NSE
param.documentation: This sets a lower limit on the speed accuracy reported by the GPS receiver that is used to set vertical velocity observation noise. If the model of receiver used does not provide a speed accurcy estimate, then the parameter value will be used. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the GPS vertical velocity measurements.

param.name: EK2_VEL_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the GPS velocity measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements willbe rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_POSNE_M_NSE
param.documentation: This sets the GPS horizontal position observation noise. Increasing it reduces the weighting of GPS horizontal position measurements.

param.name: EK2_POS_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the GPS position measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_GLITCH_RAD
param.documentation: This controls the maximum radial uncertainty in position between the value predicted by the filter and the value measured by the GPS before the filter position and velocity states are reset to the GPS. Making this value larger allows the filter to ignore larger GPS glitches but also means that non-GPS errors such as IMU and compass can create a larger error in position before the filter is forced back to the GPS position.

param.name: EK2_GPS_DELAY
param.documentation: This is the number of msec that the GPS measurements lag behind the inertial measurements.

param.name: EK2_ALT_SOURCE
param.documentation: This parameter controls the primary height sensor used by the EKF. If the selected option cannot be used, it will default to Baro as the primary height source. Setting 0 will use the baro altitude at all times. Setting 1 uses the range finder and is only available in combination with optical flow navigation (EK2_GPS_TYPE = 3). Setting 2 uses GPS. Setting 3 uses the range beacon data. NOTE - the EK2_RNG_USE_HGT parameter can be used to switch to range-finder when close to the ground.

param.name: EK2_ALT_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in the altitude measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the baro measurement and will make the filter respond more slowly to baro measurement errors, but will make it more sensitive to GPS and accelerometer errors.

param.name: EK2_HGT_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the height measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_HGT_DELAY
param.documentation: This is the number of msec that the Height measurements lag behind the inertial measurements.

param.name: EK2_MAG_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in magnetometer measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

param.name: EK2_MAG_CAL
param.documentation: This determines when the filter will use the 3-axis magnetometer fusion model that estimates both earth and body fixed magnetic field states and when it will use a simpler magnetic heading fusion model that does not use magnetic field states. The 3-axis magnetometer fusion is only suitable for use when the external magnetic field environment is stable. EK2_MAG_CAL = 0 uses heading fusion on ground, 3-axis fusion in-flight, and is the default setting for Plane users. EK2_MAG_CAL = 1 uses 3-axis fusion only when manoeuvring. EK2_MAG_CAL = 2 uses heading fusion at all times, is recommended if the external magnetic field is varying and is the default for rovers. EK2_MAG_CAL = 3 uses heading fusion on the ground and 3-axis fusion after the first in-air field and yaw reset has completed, and is the default for copters. EK2_MAG_CAL = 4 uses 3-axis fusion at all times. NOTE : Use of simple heading magnetometer fusion makes vehicle compass calibration and alignment errors harder for the EKF to detect which reduces the sensitivity of the Copter EKF failsafe algorithm. NOTE: The fusion mode can be forced to 2 for specific EKF cores using the EK2_MAG_MASK parameter.

param.name: EK2_MAG_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the magnetometer measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_EAS_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in equivalent airspeed measurements used by planes. Increasing it reduces the weighting of airspeed measurements and will make wind speed estimates less noisy and slower to converge. Increasing also increases navigation errors when dead-reckoning without GPS measurements.

param.name: EK2_EAS_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the airspeed measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_RNG_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in the range finder measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting on this measurement.

param.name: EK2_RNG_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the range finder innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_MAX_FLOW
param.documentation: This sets the magnitude maximum optical flow rate in rad/sec that will be accepted by the filter

param.name: EK2_FLOW_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise and errors in optical flow measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

param.name: EK2_FLOW_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the optical flow innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_FLOW_DELAY
param.documentation: This is the number of msec that the optical flow measurements lag behind the inertial measurements. It is the time from the end of the optical flow averaging period and does not include the time delay due to the 100msec of averaging within the flow sensor.

param.name: EK2_GYRO_P_NSE
param.documentation: This control disturbance noise controls the growth of estimated error due to gyro measurement errors excluding bias. Increasing it makes the flter trust the gyro measurements less and other measurements more.

param.name: EK2_ACC_P_NSE
param.documentation: This control disturbance noise controls the growth of estimated error due to accelerometer measurement errors excluding bias. Increasing it makes the flter trust the accelerometer measurements less and other measurements more.

param.name: EK2_GBIAS_P_NSE
param.documentation: This state process noise controls growth of the gyro delta angle bias state error estimate. Increasing it makes rate gyro bias estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EK2_GSCL_P_NSE
param.documentation: This noise controls the rate of gyro scale factor learning. Increasing it makes rate gyro scale factor estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EK2_ABIAS_P_NSE
param.documentation: This noise controls the growth of the vertical accelerometer delta velocity bias state error estimate. Increasing it makes accelerometer bias estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EK2_WIND_P_NSE
param.documentation: This state process noise controls the growth of wind state error estimates. Increasing it makes wind estimation faster and noisier.

param.humanName: Height rate to wind process noise scaler
param.name: EK2_WIND_PSCALE
param.documentation: This controls how much the process noise on the wind states is increased when gaining or losing altitude to take into account changes in wind speed and direction with altitude. Increasing this parameter increases how rapidly the wind states adapt when changing altitude, but does make wind velocity estimation noiser.

param.name: EK2_GPS_CHECK
param.documentation: This is a 1 byte bitmap controlling which GPS preflight checks are performed. Set to 0 to bypass all checks. Set to 255 perform all checks. Set to 3 to check just the number of satellites and HDoP. Set to 31 for the most rigorous checks that will still allow checks to pass when the copter is moving, eg launch from a boat.
param.field: 0:NSats,1:HDoP,2:speed error,3:position error,4:yaw error,5:pos drift,6:vert speed,7:horiz speed

param.name: EK2_IMU_MASK
param.documentation: 1 byte bitmap of IMUs to use in EKF2. A separate instance of EKF2 will be started for each IMU selected. Set to 1 to use the first IMU only (default), set to 2 to use the second IMU only, set to 3 to use the first and second IMU. Additional IMU's can be used up to a maximum of 6 if memory and processing resources permit. There may be insufficient memory and processing resources to run multiple instances. If this occurs EKF2 will fail to start.

param.name: EK2_CHECK_SCALE
param.documentation: This scales the thresholds that are used to check GPS accuracy before it is used by the EKF. A value of 100 is the default. Values greater than 100 increase and values less than 100 reduce the maximum GPS error the EKF will accept. A value of 200 will double the allowable GPS error.

param.name: EK2_NOAID_M_NSE
param.documentation: This sets the amount of position variation that the EKF allows for when operating without external measurements (eg GPS or optical flow). Increasing this parameter makes the EKF attitude estimate less sensitive to vehicle manoeuvres but more sensitive to IMU errors.

param.name: EK2_LOG_MASK
param.documentation: This sets the IMU mask of sensors to do full logging for

param.name: EK2_YAW_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in yaw measurements from the magnetometer. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

param.name: EK2_YAW_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the magnetometer yaw measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_TAU_OUTPUT
param.documentation: Sets the time constant of the output complementary filter/predictor in centi-seconds.

param.name: EK2_MAGE_P_NSE
param.documentation: This state process noise controls the growth of earth magnetic field state error estimates. Increasing it makes earth magnetic field estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EK2_MAGB_P_NSE
param.documentation: This state process noise controls the growth of body magnetic field state error estimates. Increasing it makes magnetometer bias error estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EK2_RNG_USE_HGT
param.documentation: The range finder will be used as the primary height source when below a specified percentage of the sensor maximum as set by the RNGFND_MAX_CM parameter. Set to -1 to prevent range finder use.

param.name: EK2_TERR_GRAD
param.documentation: Specifies the maximum gradient of the terrain below the vehicle when it is using range finder as a height reference

param.name: EK2_BCN_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in the range beacon measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting on this measurement.

param.name: EK2_BCN_I_GTE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the range beacon measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_BCN_DELAY
param.documentation: This is the number of msec that the range beacon measurements lag behind the inertial measurements. It is the time from the end of the optical flow averaging period and does not include the time delay due to the 100msec of averaging within the flow sensor.

param.name: EK2_RNG_USE_SPD
param.documentation: The range finder will not be used as the primary height source when the horizontal ground speed is greater than this value.

param.humanName: Bitmask of active EKF cores that will always use heading fusion
param.name: EK2_MAG_MASK
param.documentation: 1 byte bitmap of EKF cores that will disable magnetic field states and use simple magnetic heading fusion at all times. This parameter enables specified cores to be used as a backup for flight into an environment with high levels of external magnetic interference which may degrade the EKF attitude estimate when using 3-axis magnetometer fusion. NOTE : Use of a different magnetometer fusion algorithm on different cores makes unwanted EKF core switches due to magnetometer errors more likely.

param.name: EK3_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables EKF3. Enabling EKF3 only makes the maths run, it does not mean it will be used for flight control. To use it for flight control set AHRS_EKF_TYPE=3. A reboot or restart will need to be performed after changing the value of EK3_ENABLE for it to take effect.

param.name: EK3_GPS_TYPE
param.documentation: This controls use of GPS measurements : 0 = use 3D velocity & 2D position, 1 = use 2D velocity and 2D position, 2 = use 2D position, 3 = Inhibit GPS use - this can be useful when flying with an optical flow sensor in an environment where GPS quality is poor and subject to large multipath errors.

param.name: EK3_VELNE_M_NSE
param.documentation: This sets a lower limit on the speed accuracy reported by the GPS receiver that is used to set horizontal velocity observation noise. If the model of receiver used does not provide a speed accurcy estimate, then the parameter value will be used. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the GPS horizontal velocity measurements.

param.name: EK3_VELD_M_NSE
param.documentation: This sets a lower limit on the speed accuracy reported by the GPS receiver that is used to set vertical velocity observation noise. If the model of receiver used does not provide a speed accurcy estimate, then the parameter value will be used. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the GPS vertical velocity measurements.

param.name: EK3_VEL_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the GPS velocity measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements willbe rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK3_POSNE_M_NSE
param.documentation: This sets the GPS horizontal position observation noise. Increasing it reduces the weighting of GPS horizontal position measurements.

param.name: EK3_POS_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the GPS position measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK3_GLITCH_RAD
param.documentation: This controls the maximum radial uncertainty in position between the value predicted by the filter and the value measured by the GPS before the filter position and velocity states are reset to the GPS. Making this value larger allows the filter to ignore larger GPS glitches but also means that non-GPS errors such as IMU and compass can create a larger error in position before the filter is forced back to the GPS position.

param.name: EK3_ALT_SOURCE
param.documentation: This parameter controls the primary height sensor used by the EKF. If the selected option cannot be used, it will default to Baro as the primary height source. Setting 0 will use the baro altitude at all times. Setting 1 uses the range finder and is only available in combination with optical flow navigation (EK3_GPS_TYPE = 3). Setting 2 uses GPS. Setting 3 uses the range beacon data. NOTE - the EK3_RNG_USE_HGT parameter can be used to switch to range-finder when close to the ground.

param.name: EK3_ALT_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in the altitude measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the baro measurement and will make the filter respond more slowly to baro measurement errors, but will make it more sensitive to GPS and accelerometer errors.

param.name: EK3_HGT_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the height measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK3_HGT_DELAY
param.documentation: This is the number of msec that the Height measurements lag behind the inertial measurements.

param.name: EK3_MAG_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in magnetometer measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

param.name: EK3_MAG_CAL
param.documentation: This determines when the filter will use the 3-axis magnetometer fusion model that estimates both earth and body fixed magnetic field states and when it will use a simpler magnetic heading fusion model that does not use magnetic field states. The 3-axis magnetometer fusion is only suitable for use when the external magnetic field environment is stable. EK3_MAG_CAL = 0 uses heading fusion on ground, 3-axis fusion in-flight, and is the default setting for Plane users. EK3_MAG_CAL = 1 uses 3-axis fusion only when manoeuvring. EK3_MAG_CAL = 2 uses heading fusion at all times, is recommended if the external magnetic field is varying and is the default for rovers. EK3_MAG_CAL = 3 uses heading fusion on the ground and 3-axis fusion after the first in-air field and yaw reset has completed, and is the default for copters. EK3_MAG_CAL = 4 uses 3-axis fusion at all times. NOTE : Use of simple heading magnetometer fusion makes vehicle compass calibration and alignment errors harder for the EKF to detect which reduces the sensitivity of the Copter EKF failsafe algorithm. NOTE: The fusion mode can be forced to 2 for specific EKF cores using the EK3_MAG_MASK parameter.

param.name: EK3_MAG_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the magnetometer measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK3_EAS_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in equivalent airspeed measurements used by planes. Increasing it reduces the weighting of airspeed measurements and will make wind speed estimates less noisy and slower to converge. Increasing also increases navigation errors when dead-reckoning without GPS measurements.

param.name: EK3_EAS_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the airspeed measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK3_RNG_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in the range finder measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting on this measurement.

param.name: EK3_RNG_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the range finder innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK3_MAX_FLOW
param.documentation: This sets the magnitude maximum optical flow rate in rad/sec that will be accepted by the filter

param.name: EK3_FLOW_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise and errors in optical flow measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

param.name: EK3_FLOW_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the optical flow innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK3_FLOW_DELAY
param.documentation: This is the number of msec that the optical flow measurements lag behind the inertial measurements. It is the time from the end of the optical flow averaging period and does not include the time delay due to the 100msec of averaging within the flow sensor.

param.name: EK3_GYRO_P_NSE
param.documentation: This control disturbance noise controls the growth of estimated error due to gyro measurement errors excluding bias. Increasing it makes the flter trust the gyro measurements less and other measurements more.

param.name: EK3_ACC_P_NSE
param.documentation: This control disturbance noise controls the growth of estimated error due to accelerometer measurement errors excluding bias. Increasing it makes the flter trust the accelerometer measurements less and other measurements more.

param.name: EK3_GBIAS_P_NSE
param.documentation: This state process noise controls growth of the gyro delta angle bias state error estimate. Increasing it makes rate gyro bias estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EK3_ABIAS_P_NSE
param.documentation: This noise controls the growth of the vertical accelerometer delta velocity bias state error estimate. Increasing it makes accelerometer bias estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EK3_WIND_P_NSE
param.documentation: This state process noise controls the growth of wind state error estimates. Increasing it makes wind estimation faster and noisier.

param.humanName: Height rate to wind process noise scaler
param.name: EK3_WIND_PSCALE
param.documentation: This controls how much the process noise on the wind states is increased when gaining or losing altitude to take into account changes in wind speed and direction with altitude. Increasing this parameter increases how rapidly the wind states adapt when changing altitude, but does make wind velocity estimation noiser.

param.name: EK3_GPS_CHECK
param.documentation: This is a 1 byte bitmap controlling which GPS preflight checks are performed. Set to 0 to bypass all checks. Set to 255 perform all checks. Set to 3 to check just the number of satellites and HDoP. Set to 31 for the most rigorous checks that will still allow checks to pass when the copter is moving, eg launch from a boat.
param.field: 0:NSats,1:HDoP,2:speed error,3:position error,4:yaw error,5:pos drift,6:vert speed,7:horiz speed

param.name: EK3_IMU_MASK
param.documentation: 1 byte bitmap of IMUs to use in EKF3. A separate instance of EKF3 will be started for each IMU selected. Set to 1 to use the first IMU only (default), set to 2 to use the second IMU only, set to 3 to use the first and second IMU. Additional IMU's can be used up to a maximum of 6 if memory and processing resources permit. There may be insufficient memory and processing resources to run multiple instances. If this occurs EKF3 will fail to start.

param.name: EK3_CHECK_SCALE
param.documentation: This scales the thresholds that are used to check GPS accuracy before it is used by the EKF. A value of 100 is the default. Values greater than 100 increase and values less than 100 reduce the maximum GPS error the EKF will accept. A value of 200 will double the allowable GPS error.

param.name: EK3_NOAID_M_NSE
param.documentation: This sets the amount of position variation that the EKF allows for when operating without external measurements (eg GPS or optical flow). Increasing this parameter makes the EKF attitude estimate less sensitive to vehicle manoeuvres but more sensitive to IMU errors.

param.name: EK3_LOG_MASK
param.documentation: This sets the IMU mask of sensors to do full logging for

param.name: EK3_YAW_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in yaw measurements from the magnetometer. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

param.name: EK3_YAW_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the magnetometer yaw measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK3_TAU_OUTPUT
param.documentation: Sets the time constant of the output complementary filter/predictor in centi-seconds.

param.name: EK3_MAGE_P_NSE
param.documentation: This state process noise controls the growth of earth magnetic field state error estimates. Increasing it makes earth magnetic field estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EK3_MAGB_P_NSE
param.documentation: This state process noise controls the growth of body magnetic field state error estimates. Increasing it makes magnetometer bias error estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EK3_RNG_USE_HGT
param.documentation: The range finder will be used as the primary height source when below a specified percentage of the sensor maximum as set by the RNGFND_MAX_CM parameter. Set to -1 to prevent range finder use.

param.name: EK3_TERR_GRAD
param.documentation: Specifies the maximum gradient of the terrain below the vehicle when it is using range finder as a height reference

param.name: EK3_BCN_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in the range beacon measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting on this measurement.

param.name: EK3_BCN_I_GTE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the range beacon measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK3_BCN_DELAY
param.documentation: This is the number of msec that the range beacon measurements lag behind the inertial measurements.

param.name: EK3_RNG_USE_SPD
param.documentation: The range finder will not be used as the primary height source when the horizontal ground speed is greater than this value.

param.name: EK3_ACC_BIAS_LIM
param.documentation: The accelerometer bias state will be limited to +- this value

param.humanName: Bitmask of active EKF cores that will always use heading fusion
param.name: EK3_MAG_MASK
param.documentation: 1 byte bitmap of EKF cores that will disable magnetic field states and use simple magnetic heading fusion at all times. This parameter enables specified cores to be used as a backup for flight into an environment with high levels of external magnetic interference which may degrade the EKF attitude estimate when using 3-axis magnetometer fusion. NOTE : Use of a different magnetometer fusion algorithm on different cores makes unwanted EKF core switches due to magnetometer errors more likely.

param.name: FENCE_ENABLE
param.documentation: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the fence functionality

param.name: FENCE_TYPE
param.documentation: Enabled fence types held as bitmask

param.name: FENCE_ACTION
param.documentation: What action should be taken when fence is breached

param.name: FENCE_ALT_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum altitude allowed before geofence triggers

param.name: FENCE_RADIUS
param.documentation: Circle fence radius which when breached will cause an RTL

param.name: FENCE_MARGIN
param.documentation: Distance that autopilot's should maintain from the fence to avoid a breach

param.name: FENCE_TOTAL
param.documentation: Number of polygon points saved in eeprom (do not update manually)

param.name: FENCE_ALT_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum altitude allowed before geofence triggers

param.name: FLOW_ENABLE
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable optical flow. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable optical flow

param.humanName: X axis optical flow scale factor correction
param.name: FLOW_FXSCALER
param.documentation: This sets the parts per thousand scale factor correction applied to the flow sensor X axis optical rate. It can be used to correct for variations in effective focal length. Each positive increment of 1 increases the scale factor applied to the X axis optical flow reading by 0.1%. Negative values reduce the scale factor.

param.humanName: Y axis optical flow scale factor correction
param.name: FLOW_FYSCALER
param.documentation: This sets the parts per thousand scale factor correction applied to the flow sensor Y axis optical rate. It can be used to correct for variations in effective focal length. Each positive increment of 1 increases the scale factor applied to the Y axis optical flow reading by 0.1%. Negative values reduce the scale factor.

param.name: FLOW_ORIENT_YAW
param.documentation: Specifies the number of centi-degrees that the flow sensor is yawed relative to the vehicle. A sensor with its X-axis pointing to the right of the vehicle X axis has a positive yaw angle.

param.name: FLOW_POS_X
param.documentation: X position of the optical flow sensor focal point in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin.

param.name: FLOW_POS_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the optical flow sensor focal point in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin.

param.name: FLOW_POS_Z
param.documentation: Z position of the optical flow sensor focal point in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin.

param.name: FLOW_BUS_ID
param.documentation: This is used to select between multiple possible bus IDs for some sensor types. For PX4Flow you can choose 0 to 7 for the 8 possible addresses on the I2C bus.

param.name: GND_ABS_PRESS
param.documentation: calibrated ground pressure in Pascals

param.name: GND_TEMP
param.documentation: calibrated ground temperature in degrees Celsius

param.name: GND_ALT_OFFSET
param.documentation: altitude offset in meters added to barometric altitude. This is used to allow for automatic adjustment of the base barometric altitude by a ground station equipped with a barometer. The value is added to the barometric altitude read by the aircraft. It is automatically reset to 0 when the barometer is calibrated on each reboot or when a preflight calibration is performed.

param.name: GND_PRIMARY
param.documentation: This selects which barometer will be the primary if multiple barometers are found

param.name: GND_EXT_BUS
param.documentation: This selects the bus number for looking for an I2C barometer

param.name: GND_SPEC_GRAV
param.documentation: This sets the specific gravity of the fluid when flying an underwater ROV.

param.name: GND_ABS_PRESS2
param.documentation: calibrated ground pressure in Pascals

param.name: GND_ABS_PRESS3
param.documentation: calibrated ground pressure in Pascals

param.name: GPS_TYPE
param.documentation: GPS type

param.name: GPS_TYPE2
param.documentation: GPS type of 2nd GPS

param.name: GPS_NAVFILTER
param.documentation: Navigation filter engine setting

param.name: GPS_AUTO_SWITCH
param.documentation: Automatic switchover to GPS reporting best lock

param.humanName: Minimum Lock Type Accepted for DGPS
param.name: GPS_MIN_DGPS
param.documentation: Sets the minimum type of differential GPS corrections required before allowing to switch into DGPS mode.

param.name: GPS_SBAS_MODE
param.documentation: This sets the SBAS (satellite based augmentation system) mode if available on this GPS. If set to 2 then the SBAS mode is not changed in the GPS. Otherwise the GPS will be reconfigured to enable/disable SBAS. Disabling SBAS may be worthwhile in some parts of the world where an SBAS signal is available but the baseline is too long to be useful.

param.name: GPS_MIN_ELEV
param.documentation: This sets the minimum elevation of satellites above the horizon for them to be used for navigation. Setting this to -100 leaves the minimum elevation set to the GPS modules default.

param.name: GPS_INJECT_TO
param.documentation: The GGS can send raw serial packets to inject data to multiple GPSes.

param.name: GPS_SBP_LOGMASK
param.documentation: Masked with the SBP msg_type field to determine whether SBR1/SBR2 data is logged

param.name: GPS_RAW_DATA
param.documentation: Enable logging of RXM raw data from uBlox which includes carrier phase and pseudo range information. This allows for post processing of dataflash logs for more precise positioning. Note that this requires a raw capable uBlox such as the 6P or 6T.

param.name: GPS_GNSS_MODE
param.documentation: Bitmask for what GNSS system to use on the first GPS (all unchecked or zero to leave GPS as configured)

param.name: GPS_SAVE_CFG
param.documentation: Determines whether the configuration for this GPS should be written to non-volatile memory on the GPS. Currently working for UBlox 6 series and above.

param.name: GPS_GNSS_MODE2
param.documentation: Bitmask for what GNSS system to use on the second GPS (all unchecked or zero to leave GPS as configured)

param.name: GPS_AUTO_CONFIG
param.documentation: Controls if the autopilot should automatically configure the GPS based on the parameters and default settings

param.name: GPS_RATE_MS
param.documentation: Controls how often the GPS should provide a position update. Lowering below 5Hz is not allowed

param.name: GPS_RATE_MS2
param.documentation: Controls how often the GPS should provide a position update. Lowering below 5Hz is not allowed

param.name: GPS_POS1_X
param.documentation: X position of the first GPS antenna in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

param.name: GPS_POS1_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the first GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

param.name: GPS_POS1_Z
param.documentation: Z position of the first GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

param.name: GPS_POS2_X
param.documentation: X position of the second GPS antenna in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

param.name: GPS_POS2_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the second GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

param.name: GPS_POS2_Z
param.documentation: Z position of the second GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

param.name: GPS_DELAY_MS
param.documentation: Controls the amount of GPS measurement delay that the autopilot compensates for. Set to zero to use the default delay for the detected GPS type.

param.name: GPS_DELAY_MS2
param.documentation: Controls the amount of GPS measurement delay that the autopilot compensates for. Set to zero to use the default delay for the detected GPS type.

param.name: GPS_BLEND_MASK
param.documentation: Determines which of the accuracy measures Horizontal position, Vertical Position and Speed are used to calculate the weighting on each GPS receiver when soft switching has been selected by setting GPS_AUTO_SWITCH to 2

param.name: GPS_BLEND_TC
param.documentation: Controls the slowest time constant applied to the calculation of GPS position and height offsets used to adjust different GPS receivers for steady state position differences.

param.name: GRIP_ENABLE
param.documentation: Gripper enable/disable

param.name: GRIP_TYPE
param.documentation: Gripper enable/disable

param.name: GRIP_GRAB
param.documentation: PWM value sent to Gripper to initiate grabbing the cargo

param.name: GRIP_RELEASE
param.documentation: PWM value sent to Gripper to release the cargo

param.name: GRIP_NEUTRAL
param.documentation: PWM value sent to grabber when not grabbing or releasing

param.name: GRIP_REGRAB
param.documentation: Time in seconds that gripper will regrab the cargo to ensure grip has not weakened; 0 to disable

param.name: GRIP_UAVCAN_ID
param.documentation: Refer to https://docs.zubax.com/opengrab_epm_v3#UAVCAN_interface

param.name: H_SV1_POS
param.documentation: Angular location of swash servo #1

param.name: H_SV2_POS
param.documentation: Angular location of swash servo #2

param.name: H_SV3_POS
param.documentation: Angular location of swash servo #3

param.name: H_TAIL_TYPE
param.documentation: Tail type selection. Simpler yaw controller used if external gyro is selected

param.name: H_SWASH_TYPE
param.documentation: Swash Type Setting - either 3-servo CCPM or H1 Mechanical Mixing

param.name: H_GYR_GAIN
param.documentation: PWM sent to external gyro on ch7 when tail type is Servo w/ ExtGyro

param.name: H_PHANG
param.documentation: Phase angle correction for rotor head. If pitching the swash forward induces a roll, this can be correct the problem

param.name: H_COLYAW
param.documentation: Feed-forward compensation to automatically add rudder input when collective pitch is increased. Can be positive or negative depending on mechanics.

param.name: H_FLYBAR_MODE
param.documentation: Flybar present or not. Affects attitude controller used during ACRO flight mode

param.humanName: Direct Drive VarPitch Tail ESC speed
param.name: H_TAIL_SPEED
param.documentation: Direct Drive VarPitch Tail ESC speed. Only used when TailType is DirectDrive VarPitch

param.name: H_GYR_GAIN_ACRO
param.documentation: PWM sent to external gyro on ch7 when tail type is Servo w/ ExtGyro. A value of zero means to use H_GYR_GAIN

param.name: H_RSC_PWM_MIN
param.documentation: This sets the PWM output on RSC channel for maximum rotor speed

param.name: H_RSC_PWM_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the PWM output on RSC channel for miniumum rotor speed

param.name: H_RSC_PWM_REV
param.documentation: This controls reversal of the RSC channel output

param.name: H_SV1_POS
param.documentation: Angular location of swash servo #1

param.name: H_SV2_POS
param.documentation: Angular location of swash servo #2

param.name: H_SV3_POS
param.documentation: Angular location of swash servo #3

param.name: H_SV4_POS
param.documentation: Angular location of swash servo #4

param.name: H_SV5_POS
param.documentation: Angular location of swash servo #5

param.name: H_SV6_POS
param.documentation: Angular location of swash servo #6

param.name: H_PHANG1
param.documentation: Phase angle correction for rotor head. If pitching the swash forward induces a roll, this can be correct the problem

param.name: H_PHANG2
param.documentation: Phase angle correction for rotor head. If pitching the swash forward induces a roll, this can be correct the problem

param.name: H_DUAL_MODE
param.documentation: Sets the dual mode of the heli, either as tandem or as transverse.

param.name: H_DCP_SCALER
param.documentation: Scaling factor applied to the differential-collective-pitch

param.name: H_DCP_YAW
param.documentation: Feed-forward compensation to automatically add yaw input when differential collective pitch is applied.

param.name: H_YAW_SCALER
param.documentation: Scaler for mixing yaw into roll or pitch.

param.name: H_RSC_PWM_MIN
param.documentation: This sets the PWM output on RSC channel for maximum rotor speed

param.name: H_RSC_PWM_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the PWM output on RSC channel for miniumum rotor speed

param.name: H_RSC_PWM_REV
param.documentation: This controls reversal of the RSC channel output

param.humanName: Collective Pitch Minimum for rear swashplate
param.name: H_COL2_MIN
param.documentation: Lowest possible servo position for the rear swashplate

param.humanName: Collective Pitch Maximum for rear swashplate
param.name: H_COL2_MAX
param.documentation: Highest possible servo position for the rear swashplate

param.humanName: Collective Pitch Mid-Point for rear swashplate
param.name: H_COL2_MID
param.documentation: Swash servo position corresponding to zero collective pitch for the rear swashplate (or zero lift for Asymmetrical blades)

param.name: H_COL_MIN
param.documentation: Lowest possible servo position for the swashplate

param.name: H_COL_MAX
param.documentation: Highest possible servo position for the swashplate

param.name: H_COL_MID
param.documentation: Swash servo position corresponding to zero collective pitch (or zero lift for Asymmetrical blades)

param.name: H_SV_MAN
param.documentation: Manual servo override for swash set-up. Do not set this manually!

param.name: H_RSC_SETPOINT
param.documentation: PWM passed to the external motor governor when external governor is enabled

param.name: H_RSC_MODE
param.documentation: Determines the method of rotor speed control

param.name: H_LAND_COL_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum collective position while landed or landing

param.name: H_RSC_RAMP_TIME
param.documentation: Time in seconds for the output to the main rotor's ESC to reach full speed

param.name: H_RSC_RUNUP_TIME
param.documentation: Time in seconds for the main rotor to reach full speed. Must be longer than RSC_RAMP_TIME

param.name: H_RSC_CRITICAL
param.documentation: Rotor speed below which flight is not possible

param.name: H_RSC_IDLE
param.documentation: Rotor speed output while armed but rotor control speed is not engaged

param.name: H_RSC_POWER_LOW
param.documentation: Throttle output at zero collective pitch. This is on a scale from 0 to 1000, where 1000 is full throttle and 0 is zero throttle. Actual PWM values are controlled by H_RSC_PWM_MIN and H_RSC_PWM_MAX. Zero collective pitch is defined by H_COL_MID.

param.name: H_RSC_POWER_HIGH
param.documentation: Throttle output at maximum collective pitch. This is on a scale from 0 to 1000, where 1000 is full throttle and 0 is zero throttle. Actual PWM values are controlled by H_RSC_PWM_MIN and H_RSC_PWM_MAX.

param.name: H_CYC_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum pitch angle of the swash plate

param.name: H_SV_TEST
param.documentation: Number of cycles to run servo test on boot-up

param.humanName: Throttle servo negative collective power position
param.name: H_RSC_POWER_NEGC
param.documentation: Throttle output at full negative collective pitch. This is on a scale from 0 to 1000, where 1000 is full throttle and 0 is zero throttle. Actual PWM values are controlled by H_RSC_PWM_MIN and H_RSC_PWM_MAX. If this is equal to H_RSC_POWER_HIGH then you will have a symmetric V-curve for the throttle response.

param.name: H_RSC_SLEWRATE
param.documentation: This controls the maximum rate at which the throttle output can change, as a percentage per second. A value of 100 means the throttle can change over its full range in one second. A value of zero gives unlimited slew rate.

param.name: ICE_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables internal combusion engine control

param.name: ICE_START_CHAN
param.documentation: This is an RC input channel for requesting engine start. Engine will try to start when channel is at or above 1700. Engine will stop when channel is at or below 1300. Between 1301 and 1699 the engine will not change state unless a MAVLink command or mission item commands a state change, or the vehicle is disamed.

param.name: ICE_STARTER_TIME
param.documentation: This is the number of seconds to run the starter when trying to start the engine

param.name: ICE_START_DELAY
param.documentation: Delay between start attempts

param.name: ICE_RPM_THRESH
param.documentation: This is the measured RPM above which tne engine is considered to be running

param.name: ICE_PWM_IGN_ON
param.documentation: This is the value sent to the ignition channel when on

param.name: ICE_PWM_IGN_OFF
param.documentation: This is the value sent to the ignition channel when off

param.name: ICE_PWM_STRT_ON
param.documentation: This is the value sent to the starter channel when on

param.name: ICE_PWM_STRT_OFF
param.documentation: This is the value sent to the starter channel when off

param.name: ICE_RPM_CHAN
param.documentation: This is which of the RPM instances to use for detecting the RPM of the engine

param.name: ICE_START_PCT
param.documentation: This is the percentage throttle output for engine start

param.name: IM_STAB_COL_1
param.documentation: Helicopter's minimum collective pitch setting at zero throttle input in Stabilize mode

param.name: IM_STAB_COL_2
param.documentation: Helicopter's collective pitch setting at mid-low throttle input in Stabilize mode

param.name: IM_STAB_COL_3
param.documentation: Helicopter's collective pitch setting at mid-high throttle input in Stabilize mode

param.name: IM_STAB_COL_4
param.documentation: Helicopter's maximum collective pitch setting at full throttle input in Stabilize mode

param.name: IM_ACRO_COL_EXP
param.documentation: Used to soften collective pitch inputs near center point in Acro mode.

param.name: INS_GYROFFS_X
param.documentation: Gyro sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYROFFS_Y
param.documentation: Gyro sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYROFFS_Z
param.documentation: Gyro sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYR2OFFS_X
param.documentation: Gyro2 sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYR2OFFS_Y
param.documentation: Gyro2 sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYR2OFFS_Z
param.documentation: Gyro2 sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYR3OFFS_X
param.documentation: Gyro3 sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYR3OFFS_Y
param.documentation: Gyro3 sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYR3OFFS_Z
param.documentation: Gyro3 sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_ACCSCAL_X
param.documentation: Accelerometer scaling of X axis. Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS_ACCSCAL_Y
param.documentation: Accelerometer scaling of Y axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS_ACCSCAL_Z
param.documentation: Accelerometer scaling of Z axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS_ACCOFFS_X
param.documentation: Accelerometer offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_ACCOFFS_Y
param.documentation: Accelerometer offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_ACCOFFS_Z
param.documentation: Accelerometer offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_ACC2SCAL_X

param.documentation: Filter cutoff frequency for gyroscopes. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. This option takes effect on the next reboot. A value of zero means no filtering (not recommended!)

param.name: INS_ACCEL_FILTER
param.documentation: Filter cutoff frequency for accelerometers. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. This option takes effect on the next reboot. A value of zero means no filtering (not recommended!)

param.humanName: Stillness threshold for detecting if we are moving
param.name: INS_STILL_THRESH
param.documentation: Threshold to tolerate vibration to determine if vehicle is motionless. This depends on the frame type and if there is a constant vibration due to motors before launch or after landing. Total motionless is about 0.05. Suggested values: Planes/rover use 0.1, multirotors use 1, tradHeli uses 5

param.name: INS_POS1_X
param.documentation: X position of the first IMU Accelerometer in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. param.name: INS_FAST_SAMPLE
param.documentation: Mask of IMUs to enable fast sampling on, if available

param.name: LAND_SLOPE_RCALC
param.documentation: This parameter is used when using a rangefinder during landing for altitude correction from baro drift (RNGFND_LANDING=1) and the altitude correction indicates your altitude is lower than the intended slope path. This value is the threshold of the correction to re-calculate the landing approach slope. Set to zero to keep the original slope all the way down and any detected baro drift will be corrected by pitching/throttling up to snap back to resume the original slope path. Otherwise, when a rangefinder altitude correction exceeds this threshold it will trigger a slope re-calculate to give a shallower slope. This also smoothes out the approach when flying over objects such as trees. Recommend a value of 2m.

param.name: LAND_ABORT_DEG
param.documentation: This parameter is used when using a rangefinder during landing for altitude correction from baro drift (RNGFND_LANDING=1) and the altitude correction indicates your actual altitude is higher than the intended slope path. Normally it would pitch down steeply but that can result in a crash with high airspeed so this allows remembering the baro offset and self-abort the landing and come around for another landing with the correct baro offset applied for a perfect slope. An auto-abort go-around will only happen once, next attempt will not auto-abort again. This operation happens entirely automatically in AUTO mode. This value is the delta degrees threshold to trigger the go-around compared to the original slope. Example: if set to 5 deg and the mission planned slope is 15 deg then if the new slope is 21 then it will go-around. Set to 0 to disable. Requires LAND_SLOPE_RCALC > 0.

param.name: LAND_PITCH_CD
param.documentation: Used in autoland to give the minimum pitch in the final stage of landing (after the flare). This parameter can be used to ensure that the final landing attitude is appropriate for the type of undercarriage on the aircraft. Note that it is a minimum pitch only - the landing code will control pitch above this value to try to achieve the configured landing sink rate.

param.name: LAND_FLARE_ALT
param.documentation: Altitude in autoland at which to lock heading and flare to the LAND_PITCH_CD pitch. Note that this option is secondary to LAND_FLARE_SEC. For a good landing it preferable that the flare is triggered by LAND_FLARE_SEC.

param.name: LAND_FLARE_SEC
param.documentation: Vertical time before landing point at which to lock heading and flare with the motor stopped. This is vertical time, and is calculated based solely on the current height above the ground and the current descent rate. Set to 0 if you only wish to flare based on altitude (see LAND_FLARE_ALT).

param.name: LAND_PF_ALT
param.documentation: Altitude to trigger pre-flare flight stage where LAND_PF_ARSPD controls airspeed. The pre-flare flight stage trigger works just like LAND_FLARE_ALT but higher. Disabled when LAND_PF_ARSPD is 0.

param.name: LAND_PF_SEC
param.documentation: Vertical time to ground to trigger pre-flare flight stage where LAND_PF_ARSPD controls airspeed. This pre-flare flight stage trigger works just like LAND_FLARE_SEC but earlier. Disabled when LAND_PF_ARSPD is 0.

param.name: LAND_PF_ARSPD
param.documentation: Desired airspeed during pre-flare flight stage. This is useful to reduce airspeed just before the flare. Use 0 to disable.

param.name: LAND_THR_SLEW
param.documentation: This parameter sets the slew rate for the throttle during auto landing. When this is zero the THR_SLEWRATE parameter is used during landing. The value is a percentage throttle change per second, so a value of 20 means to advance the throttle over 5 seconds on landing. Values below 50 are not recommended as it may cause a stall when airspeed is low and you can not throttle up fast enough.

param.name: LAND_DISARMDELAY
param.documentation: After a landing has completed using a LAND waypoint, automatically disarm after this many seconds have passed. Use 0 to not disarm.

param.humanName: Set servos to neutral after landing
param.name: LAND_THEN_NEUTRL
param.documentation: When enabled, after an autoland and auto-disarm via LAND_DISARMDELAY happens then set all servos to neutral. This is helpful when an aircraft has a rough landing upside down or a crazy angle causing the servos to strain.

param.name: LAND_ABORT_THR
param.documentation: Allow a landing abort to trigger with a throttle > 95%

param.name: LAND_FLAP_PERCNT
param.documentation: The amount of flaps (as a percentage) to apply in the landing approach and flare of an automatic landing

param.name: LAND_TYPE
param.documentation: Specifies the auto-landing type to use

param.name: LAND_DS_V_FWD
param.documentation: The forward velocity of the aircraft while stalled

param.name: LAND_DS_SLOPE_A
param.documentation: The a component of distance = a*wind + b

param.name: LAND_DS_SLOPE_B
param.documentation: The a component of distance = a*wind + b

param.name: LAND_DS_APP_EXT
param.documentation: The forward velocity of the aircraft while stalled

param.name: LAND_DS_V_DWN
param.documentation: The downward velocity of the aircraft while stalled

param.name: LAND_DS_SLEW_SPD
param.documentation: The speed at which the elevator slews to deepstall

param.name: LAND_DS_ELEV_PWM
param.documentation: The PWM value for the elevator at full deflection in deepstall

param.name: LAND_DS_ARSP_MAX
param.documentation: The maximum aispeed where the deepstall steering controller is allowed to have control

param.name: LAND_DS_ARSP_MIN
param.documentation: Deepstall lowest airspeed where the deepstall controller isn't allowed full control

param.name: LAND_DS_L1
param.documentation: Deepstall L1 navigational controller period

param.name: LAND_DS_L1_I
param.documentation: Deepstall L1 integratior gain

param.name: LAND_DS_DS_P
param.documentation: P Gain which produces an output value that is proportional to the current error value

param.name: LAND_DS_DS_I
param.documentation: I Gain which produces an output that is proportional to both the magnitude and the duration of the error

param.name: LAND_DS_DS_D
param.documentation: D Gain which produces an output that is proportional to the rate of change of the error

param.name: LAND_DS_DS_IMAX
param.documentation: The maximum/minimum value that the I term can output

param.name: LOG_BACKEND_TYPE
param.documentation: 0 for None, 1 for File, 2 for dataflash mavlink, 3 for both file and dataflash

param.humanName: Maximum DataFlash File Backend buffer size (in kilobytes)
param.name: LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE
param.documentation: The DataFlash_File backend uses a buffer to store data before writing to the block device. Raising this value may reduce "gaps" in your SD card logging. This buffer size may be reduced depending on available memory. PixHawk requires at least 4 kilobytes. Maximum value available here is 64 kilobytes.

param.name: LOG_DISARMED
param.documentation: If LOG_DISARMED is set to 1 then logging will be enabled while disarmed. This can make for very large logfiles but can help a lot when tracking down startup issues

param.humanName: Enable logging of information needed for Replay
param.name: LOG_REPLAY
param.documentation: If LOG_REPLAY is set to 1 then the EKF2 state estimator will log detailed information needed for diagnosing problems with the Kalman filter. It is suggested that you also raise LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE to give more buffer space for logging and use a high quality microSD card to ensure no sensor data is lost

param.humanName: Stop logging to current file on disarm
param.name: LOG_FILE_DSRMROT
param.documentation: When set, the current log file is closed when the vehicle is disarmed. If LOG_DISARMED is set then a fresh log will be opened.

param.name: MIS_TOTAL

param.name: MOT_1_DIRECTION
param.documentation: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

param.name: MOT_2_DIRECTION
param.documentation: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

param.name: MOT_3_DIRECTION
param.documentation: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

param.name: MOT_4_DIRECTION
param.documentation: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

param.name: MOT_5_DIRECTION
param.documentation: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

param.name: MOT_6_DIRECTION
param.documentation: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

param.name: MOT_7_DIRECTION
param.documentation: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

param.name: MOT_8_DIRECTION
param.documentation: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

param.name: MOT_FV_CPLNG_K
param.documentation: Used to decouple pitch from forward/vertical motion. 0 to disable, 1.2 normal

param.name: MOT_YAW_HEADROOM
param.documentation: Yaw control is given at least this pwm range

param.name: MOT_THST_EXPO
param.documentation: Motor thrust curve exponent (from 0 for linear to 1.0 for second order curve)

param.name: MOT_SPIN_MAX
param.documentation: Point at which the thrust saturates expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range

param.name: MOT_BAT_VOLT_MAX
param.documentation: Battery voltage compensation maximum voltage (voltage above this will have no additional scaling effect on thrust). Recommend 4.4 * cell count, 0 = Disabled

param.name: MOT_BAT_VOLT_MIN
param.documentation: Battery voltage compensation minimum voltage (voltage below this will have no additional scaling effect on thrust). Recommend 3.5 * cell count, 0 = Disabled

param.name: MOT_BAT_CURR_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum current over which maximum throttle is limited (0 = Disabled)

param.name: MOT_PWM_TYPE
param.documentation: This selects the output PWM type, allowing for normal PWM continuous output, OneShot or brushed motor output

param.name: MOT_PWM_MIN
param.documentation: This sets the min PWM output value that will ever be output to the motors, 0 = use input RC3_MIN

param.name: MOT_PWM_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the max PWM value that will ever be output to the motors, 0 = use input RC3_MAX

param.name: MOT_SPIN_MIN
param.documentation: Point at which the thrust starts expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range. Should be higher than MOT_SPIN_ARM.

param.name: MOT_SPIN_ARM
param.documentation: Point at which the motors start to spin expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range. Should be lower than MOT_SPIN_MIN.

param.name: MOT_BAT_CURR_TC
param.documentation: Time constant used to limit the maximum current

param.name: MOT_THST_HOVER
param.documentation: Motor thrust needed to hover expressed as a number from 0 to 1

param.name: MOT_HOVER_LEARN
param.documentation: Enable/Disable automatic learning of hover throttle

param.humanName: Motor PWM output disabled when disarmed
param.name: MOT_SAFE_DISARM
param.documentation: Disables motor PWM output when disarmed

param.name: MOT_YAW_SV_ANGLE
param.documentation: Yaw servo's maximum lean angle

param.name: MOT_SPOOL_TIME
param.documentation: Time in seconds to spool up the motors from zero to min throttle.

param.name: NAVL1_PERIOD
param.documentation: Period in seconds of L1 tracking loop. This parameter is the primary control for agressiveness of turns in auto mode. This needs to be larger for less responsive airframes. The default of 20 is quite conservative, but for most RC aircraft will lead to reasonable flight. For smaller more agile aircraft a value closer to 15 is appropriate, or even as low as 10 for some very agile aircraft. When tuning, change this value in small increments, as a value that is much too small (say 5 or 10 below the right value) can lead to very radical turns, and a risk of stalling.

param.name: NAVL1_DAMPING
param.documentation: Damping ratio for L1 control. Increase this in increments of 0.05 if you are getting overshoot in path tracking. You should not need a value below 0.7 or above 0.85.

param.name: NAVL1_XTRACK_I
param.documentation: Crosstrack error integrator gain. This gain is applied to the crosstrack error to ensure it converges to zero. Set to zero to disable. Smaller values converge slower, higher values will cause crosstrack error oscillation.

param.name: NAVL1_LIM_BANK
param.documentation: The sealevel bank angle limit for a continous loiter. (Used to calculate airframe loading limits at higher altitudes). Setting to 0, will instead just scale the loiter radius directly

param.name: NTF_LED_BRIGHT
param.documentation: Select the RGB LED brightness level. When USB is connected brightness will never be higher than low regardless of the setting.

param.name: NTF_BUZZ_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable or disable the buzzer. Only for Linux and PX4 based boards.

param.name: NTF_LED_OVERRIDE
param.documentation: This sets up the board RGB LED for override by MAVLink. Normal notify LED control is disabled

param.name: NTF_DISPLAY_TYPE
param.documentation: This sets up the type of on-board I2C display. Disabled by default.

param.name: PLND_ENABLED
param.documentation: Precision Land enabled/disabled and behaviour

param.name: PLND_TYPE
param.documentation: Precision Land Type

param.name: PLND_YAW_ALIGN
param.documentation: Yaw angle from body x-axis to sensor x-axis.

param.name: PLND_LAND_OFS_X
param.documentation: Desired landing position of the camera forward of the target in vehicle body frame

param.name: PLND_LAND_OFS_Y

param.name: PSC_ACC_XY_FILT
param.documentation: Lower values will slow the response of the navigation controller and reduce twitchiness

param.name: PTCH2SRV_TCONST
param.documentation: This controls the time constant in seconds from demanded to achieved pitch angle. A value of 0.5 is a good default and will work with nearly all models. Advanced users may want to reduce this time to obtain a faster response but there is no point setting a time less than the aircraft can achieve.

param.name: PTCH2SRV_P
param.documentation: This is the gain from pitch angle to elevator. This gain works the same way as PTCH2SRV_P in the old PID controller and can be set to the same value.

param.name: PTCH2SRV_D
param.documentation: This is the gain from pitch rate to elevator. This adjusts the damping of the pitch control loop. It has the same effect as PTCH2SRV_D in the old PID controller and can be set to the same value, but without the spikes in servo demands. This gain helps to reduce pitching in turbulence. Some airframes such as flying wings that have poor pitch damping can benefit from increasing this gain term. This should be increased in 0.01 increments as too high a value can lead to a high frequency pitch oscillation that could overstress the airframe.

param.name: PTCH2SRV_I
param.documentation: This is the gain applied to the integral of pitch angle. It has the same effect as PTCH2SRV_I in the old PID controller and can be set to the same value. Increasing this gain causes the controller to trim out constant offsets between demanded and measured pitch angle.

param.name: PTCH2SRV_RMAX_UP
param.documentation: This sets the maximum nose up pitch rate that the controller will demand (degrees/sec). Setting it to zero disables the limit.

param.name: PTCH2SRV_RMAX_DN
param.documentation: This sets the maximum nose down pitch rate that the controller will demand (degrees/sec). Setting it to zero disables the limit.

param.name: PTCH2SRV_RLL
param.documentation: This is the gain term that is applied to the pitch rate offset calculated as required to keep the nose level during turns. The default value is 1 which will work for all models. Advanced users can use it to correct for height variation in turns. If height is lost initially in turns this can be increased in small increments of 0.05 to compensate. If height is gained initially in turns then it can be decreased.

param.name: PTCH2SRV_IMAX
param.documentation: This limits the number of centi-degrees of elevator over which the integrator will operate. At the default setting of 3000 centi-degrees, the integrator will be limited to +- 30 degrees of servo travel. The maximum servo deflection is +- 45 degrees, so the default value represents a 2/3rd of the total control throw which is adequate for most aircraft unless they are severely out of trim or have very limited elevator control effectiveness.

param.name: PTCH2SRV_FF
param.documentation: This is the gain from demanded rate to elevator output.

param.name: RALLY_TOTAL
param.documentation: Number of rally points currently loaded

param.name: RALLY_LIMIT_KM
param.documentation: Maximum distance to rally point. If the closest rally point is more than this number of kilometers from the current position and the home location is closer than any of the rally points from the current position then do RTL to home rather than to the closest rally point. This prevents a leftover rally point from a different airfield being used accidentally. If this is set to 0 then the closest rally point is always used.

param.name: RALLY_INCL_HOME
param.documentation: Controls if Home is included as a Rally point (i.e. as a safe landing place) for RTL
